explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [U] determination to be successful, rich, powerful, etc. 抱负；雄心；野心
explanations_and_examples.example: She was intelligent but suffered from a lack of ambition.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [C] a strong desire to achieve sth. 追求；夙愿；理想
explanations_and_examples.example: Earlier this year, he achieved his ambition of competing in the Olympic Games.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: determined to be successful, rich, powerful, etc. 有抱负的；有雄心的；野心勃勃的
explanations_and_examples.example: She's extremely ambitious and intends to be running her own company by the time she's 30.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (also 'some day') at an unknown time in the future, esp. a long time in the future 将来会有一天；有朝一日
explanations_and_examples.example: He hopes, someday, to have his own business.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: in a way that shows no emotion when you are talking about sth. exciting, frightening, etc. 就事论事地；不带感情地；实事求是地
explanations_and_examples.example: To my surprise, he spoke about his divorce matter-of-factly.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the scientific study of living things 生物学
explanations_and_examples.example: Students might pursue a degree in biology as a path to medical school or a variety of professions.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty 解决（问题、困难）
explanations_and_examples.example: There weren't enough beds, but the matter was resolved by George sleeping on the sofa.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] books and stories about imaginary people and events 小说
explanations_and_examples.example: The book is a work of fiction and not intended as a historical account.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (AmE) a student in the first year of high school or university （高中或大学的）一年级学生
explanations_and_examples.example: It is necessary for freshmen to get to know their new studying environment in university as soon as possible.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: behave as if sth. is true when in fact you know it is not, in order to deceive people or for fun 假装；装作
explanations_and_examples.example: She pretended that she was not at home when we rang the bell.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (~ for sth.; ~ to do sth.) needing or wanting sth. very much 非常需要···的；极其需要···的
explanations_and_examples.example: The healthcare industry is desperate for solutions to its business models.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) willing to do anything to change a very bad situation, and not caring about danger （为了改变糟糕境遇而）不惜冒险的，拼命的，绝望的
explanations_and_examples.example: I had no money left and was desperate.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (infml.) a friend 朋友；伙伴
explanations_and_examples.example: Bob and I have been great buddies for years.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: amusing and interesting 使人愉快的；有趣的
explanations_and_examples.example: His books aren't particularly well-written, but they're always entertaining.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: showing or saying that you are sorry that sth. has happened, esp. because you feel guilty or embarrassed about it 道歉的；谢罪的；愧疚的
explanations_and_examples.example: She was apologetic about my injury.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: succeed in achieving sth. after trying for a long time （通过长时间努力而）得到，获得，赢得
explanations_and_examples.example: More and more women are attaining positions of power.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: possible to achieve, reach, or get 可以达到的；可以获得的
explanations_and_examples.example: We must make sure that we do not set ourselves goals that are not attainable.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the quality of trying to do sth. even when it is difficult 决心；坚韧；毅力
explanations_and_examples.example: He shows great determination to learn English.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: accepting things as they are in fact and not making decisions based on unlikely hopes for the future 现实的；实际的；实事求是的
explanations_and_examples.example: Let's be realistic about this 一 I just can't afford to pay that much money.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a thick tropical forest with many large plants growing very close together （热带）丛林
explanations_and_examples.example: We had to cut our way through dense jungle.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: certain to happen or to do sth. because a mysterious force is controlling events 命运决定的；命中注定的
explanations_and_examples.example: She says she was fated to become a writer.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) eager to go to new places and do exciting or dangerous things 喜欢冒险的；有冒险精神的
explanations_and_examples.example: I took an adventurous ski trip in Austria last year.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) not afraid of taking risks or trying new things 大胆创新的
explanations_and_examples.example: Warren is a very adventurous cook, always trying to make new dishes.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: sth. that is exotic seems unusual and interesting because it is related to a foreign country 异国风情的；外国情调的
explanations_and_examples.example: She likes traveling to all kinds of exotic locations.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [n.] 1) [C] (~ of) a group of similar things 一系列
explanations_and_examples.example: We've had a string of complaints about the program.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [n.] 2) [C, U]（由几股合成的）线，细绳，带子
explanations_and_examples.example: Her key hung on a string around her neck.

explanations_and_examples.explanation:
[vt.]3)
(strung, strung) put things together onto a thread, chain, etc. 用（线、 链等）穿起来
explanations_and_examples.example: She had strung the shells on a silver chain.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a state of disagreement or argument between people, groups, countries, etc. （意见等的）抵触，冲突，矛盾
explanations_and_examples.example: She found herself in conflict with her parents over her future career.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: in a way that involves all your feelings, interest, etc. 全心全意地；全力以赴地
explanations_and_examples.example: I agree whole-heartedly with the mayor on this issue.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if one person does sth. single-mindedly, they have one clear aim and work very hard to achieve it 一心一意地；专心致志地
explanations_and_examples.example: His ability to concentrate single-mindedly on the most important thing leads to his success.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: always wanting more food, money, power, possessions, etc. than you need 贪婪的；贪心的； 贪吃的；贪喝的
explanations_and_examples.example: He looked at the gold with greedy eyes.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: a chaotic situation is one in which everything is happening in a confused way 混乱的； 毫无秩序的
explanations_and_examples.example: The traffic in the city is chaotic in the rush hour.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) if sb. /sth. is overdue, they should have arrived before now 迟到的；延误的
explanations_and_examples.example: If you're overdue for a vacation, you can prepare for an adventure instead of cancelling it.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) not done, paid, returned, etc. by the time expected 过期未完成的；过期未付的；过期未还的
explanations_and_examples.example: These books are overdue and you should pay a fine.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: sb., esp. a child or young person, who is mature behaves in a sensible and reasonable way, as you would expect an adult to behave （尤指小孩或年轻人举止）成熟的，理智的，明白事理的
explanations_and_examples.example: We're mature enough to disagree on this issue but still respect each other.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: give sb. a particular job or make them responsible for a particular person or thing 分配，分派，指派（任务）
explanations_and_examples.example: I've been assigned the task of looking after the new students.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (BrE 【paediatrician】)a doctor who deals with children and their illnesses 儿科医生
explanations_and_examples.example: He dreams of becoming a doctor, specifically a pediatrician.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a popular product, esp. a book, that many people buy 畅销产品；畅销书
explanations_and_examples.example: His new book went straight to No. 1 on the best-seller list.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (often used in negative sentences or questions) any longer 再也（不）；（不）再
explanations_and_examples.example: You're describing a world that just doesn't exist anymore.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (strove, striven) (~ to do sth.; ~ for / after sth.)  make a great effort to achieve sth. 努力；奋斗
explanations_and_examples.example: We encourage all members to strive for the highest standards.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) extremely popular 畅销的
explanations_and_examples.example: It's almost every author's dream to become a best-selling author.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a meeting held by a person or group at which they answer questions from people who write or present news reports 记者招待会；新闻发布会
explanations_and_examples.example: The football coach held a press conference to announce his retirement.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: attractive or interesting 有吸引力的；有趣的
explanations_and_examples.example: The city offers an appealing combination of sporting and cultural events.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 舌；舌头
[C, U] a feeling of sadness that makes you think there is no hope for the future 忧伤；沮丧；消沉
explanations_and_examples.example: She suffered from severe depression after losing her job.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) when sb. feels alone and unable to meet or speak to other people 孤独；孤单
explanations_and_examples.example: After all the visitors had left, she experienced a feeling of complete isolation.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) when one group, person, or thing is separate from others 隔绝；孤立；分离
explanations_and_examples.example: Because of its geographical isolation, the area developed its own unique culture.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sb. who is paid to work for sb. else 受雇者；雇员
explanations_and_examples.example: e.g.  Alibaba Group has more than 100,000 global employees.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sb. who studies and develops ideas about the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil, etc. 哲学家
explanations_and_examples.example: Socrates and Plato are two famous Greek philosophers whose ideas are still influential today.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if a story, plan, etc. unfolds, it becomes clearer as you hear or learn more about it （使）（故事、计划等）展开；逐渐呈现；展示
explanations_and_examples.example: The scandal is still unfolding, but there may be a solution soon.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sb.'s general attitude, and the way in which they think about things and make decisions 思维模式
explanations_and_examples.example: It's quite difficult to change the mindset of the public and the press.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: become smaller in size, importance, or value, or make sth. do this （使）降低；（使）减少
explanations_and_examples.example: The new project will lessen the effects of car pollution.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) relating to your feelings or how you control them 情绪（上）的；情感（上）的
explanations_and_examples.example: Mothers are often the ones who provide emotional support for the family.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (fml.) notice, see, or recognize sth. 察觉；注意到；发觉
explanations_and_examples.example: That morning, he perceived a change in his wife's mood.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) (written) understand or think of sb. / sth. in a particular way （以某种方式）看待，理解
explanations_and_examples.example: Even as a young woman she had been perceived as a future chief executive.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: extremely brave or determined, and admired by many people 英雄的；英勇的
explanations_and_examples.example: These doctors performed heroic work in difficult conditions.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: always behaving in the same way or having the same attitudes, standards, etc. （行为、态度、标准等）一贯的，一致的
explanations_and_examples.example: He has been the team's most consistent player.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: able to continue for a long time 可持续的
explanations_and_examples.example: That sort of extreme diet is not sustainable over a long period.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] when you are healthy and strong enough to do hard work or play sports 健壮；健康
explanations_and_examples.example: They're doing some regular exercise to improve their fitness.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the ability to use your imagination to produce new ideas, make things, etc. 独创性；创造性；创造力
explanations_and_examples.example: We should have an education system that lets children use their creativity.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] a long race of about 42 kilometers or 26 miles 马拉松赛跑
explanations_and_examples.example: She ran her first marathon in just under three hours.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) used to emphasize that sth., esp. a large number, is actually true 的确；确实
explanations_and_examples.example: The Olympic Games were watched by literally billions of people around the world.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) according to the most basic or original meaning of a word or expression 按照原意；根据字面意思
explanations_and_examples.example: I said I felt like quitting, but I didn't mean it literally.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: try to do or use too much of sth., causing problems, illness, or damage 把···做得过分；把···使用过头
explanations_and_examples.example: e.g .  Be careful not to overextend yourself. You've been very ill.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (be obsessed with / by) if sb. / sth. obsesses you, you think or worry about them all the time and you cannot think about anything else 一 used to show disapproval 使痴迷；使迷恋；使心神不宁（含贬义）
explanations_and_examples.example: A lot of young girls are obsessed by their weight.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) the maximum amount, quantity, speed, etc. is the largest that is possible or is allowed 最大量的；最大限度的；最大值的
explanations_and_examples.example: To get the maximum benefit, do the exercises slowly.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a period of physical exercise, esp. as training for a sport 体育锻炼；训练
explanations_and_examples.example: She does a 20-minute workout every morning.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used to contrast sb. / sth. with another person or thing 与···不同
explanations_and_examples.example: Unlike most people in the office, I don't come to work by car.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) a situation that seems strange because it involves two ideas or qualities that are very different 自相矛盾（的情况）
explanations_and_examples.example: It is a paradox that in such a rich country there can be so much poverty.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) a statement that seems impossible because it contains two opposing ideas that are both true 悖论；似非而是的说法
explanations_and_examples.example: The paradox is that fishermen would catch more fish if they fished less.

explanations_and_examples.explanation:
vi.
(~ well / badly, etc.) work or do sth. well, badly, etc. 表现得好 / 差等
explanations_and_examples.example: The company has been performing poorly over the past year.

explanations_and_examples.explanation:
v. 
do sth. to entertain people, for example by acting a play or playing a piece of music 表演；演出
explanations_and_examples.example: I'd like to hear the music performed live.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) use a lot of time and effort trying to get sth. such as work or money 努力赢得；设法获得
explanations_and_examples.example: Top graduates from the university are chased by major companies.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) quickly follow sb. / sth. in order to catch them 追逐；追赶；追捕
explanations_and_examples.example: The dogs saw him running and chased him.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) sb. who is grounded understands their own character and knows what is really important 对自己有清醒认识的
explanations_and_examples.example: Mary says that she knows what she really wants because her family always keeps her grounded.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2）reasonable and in control of your emotions, even when this is difficult 理性的；有理智的；克制的
explanations_and_examples.example: Charles can always keep himself grounded, even when he runs into difficulty.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: producing or achieving a lot 多产的；丰饶的；富有成效的
explanations_and_examples.example: We had a very productive meeting 一 I felt we sorted out a lot of problems.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [sing.] the set of ideas and moral attitudes that are typical of a particular group （某团体的）精神特质，道德意识
explanations_and_examples.example: It is a community in which people lived according to an ethos of sharing and caring.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (infml.) if sth. is yours for the asking, you can have it if you want it 某人只要提出要求（就可以得到）
explanations_and_examples.example: A good deal of extra support is hers for the asking.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: have great success 大获成功
explanations_and_examples.example: I wasn't expecting it to work, but I hit it big when I tried the new approach.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (spoken) used when giving your personal opinion or admitting sth. 老实说；实话对你讲
explanations_and_examples.example: To tell the truth, I don't really like her.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: not take sb. / sth. with you when you leave a place 忘记带走；留下
explanations_and_examples.example: He departed for the United States, leaving the children behind with his mother.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: relax and make no effort to get involved in sth. or influence what happens 不采取行动；袖手旁观
explanations_and_examples.example: Don't just sit back and wait for new business to come to you.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used for saying that there is more than one reason for sth. 由于这样或那样的原因
explanations_and_examples.example: His travel articles are always, for one reason or another, fascinating.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (infml.) take an opportunity, accept an invitation, etc. immediately 抓住（机会）；立即接受（邀请等）
explanations_and_examples.example: This is our chance to grab at this new market.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: accept an unpleasant or sad situation and no longer feel upset or angry about it 与某事妥协，对某事让步；接受（令人不快或悲伤的现实）
explanations_and_examples.example: It's hard for the couple to come to terms with the fact that they will never have children.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: prevent sb. / sth. from making progress 阻碍某人 / 某事发展
explanations_and_examples.example: Do you think that mixed-ability teaching holds the brighter children back?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (infml.) if a name or phrase rolls or trips off your tongue, it is easy or pleasant to say （某个名字或短语）顺口
explanations_and_examples.example: Their names roll off the tongue very easily.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: be in a state of physical or mental exhaustion caused by overwork or stress 感到精疲力竭
explanations_and_examples.example: He was burned out by the time he was 21 and retired from the sport.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: the present time 现时
explanations_and_examples.example: To be able to live fully in the here and now, one must first learn how to honor the past.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: fail to win or achieve sth. 未能赢取；未能获得
explanations_and_examples.example: We're so close to getting the job done, but we keep coming up short.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: increase by small amounts until there is a large total 积累；积少成多
explanations_and_examples.example: When you're feeding a family of six the bills soon add up.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: combine things in order to make sth. that is complete, good, useful, etc. 把···拼在一起
explanations_and_examples.example: They string together image after image until the documentary is completed.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (fml.) before 在···以前
explanations_and_examples.example: All the arrangements should be completed prior to your departure.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if you are at peace, you do not feel angry, unhappy, etc. 心平气和的
explanations_and_examples.example: For the first time in months, she felt calm and at peace with the world.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used to say that sth. is completely different from what has just been said 正好 / 完全相反
explanations_and_examples.example: I didn't feel sleepy at all 一 just the opposite, in fact.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: be the opposite of 违背某事；与某事背道而驰
explanations_and_examples.example: The governor's newest policy seems to be running counter to everything he promised during his election campaign.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 贝丝（人名）
（美国政府的）国务卿（主要负责外交事务）
简·古多尔（英国生物学家、动物行为学家、人类学家）
J.J. 瓦特（美国橄榄球运动员）
埃利乌德 ; 基普乔盖（肯尼亚马拉松运动员）
《纽约时报》（报刊名）
《泰晤士报》（报刊名）
[C, U] a serious argument or disagreement 争议；争论；争端；纠纷
explanations_and_examples.example: The firm is involved in a legal dispute with its competitor.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: unable to be challenged or denied 无可争辩的；不可否认的
explanations_and_examples.example: It is indisputable that the crime rate has been decreasing.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a statement or account that makes sth. clear or easy to understand 解释；说明
explanations_and_examples.example: Could you give me a quick explanation of how the machine works?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: simple and easy to understand 简单的；易懂的
explanations_and_examples.example: The question seemed straightforward enough.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the study of the way in which money and goods are produced and used 经济学
[C] the wealth that a country gets from business and industry 经济
explanations_and_examples.example: The country's economy grew at an annual rate of more than 10 percent.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: firmly press sth., typically with your fingers 挤；捏
explanations_and_examples.example: As she waited for the interview, he squeezed her hand and wished her good luck.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (~ sb. in sth.; ~ in sth.) make sb. take part in sth.; take part in sth. （使）从事，参加
explanations_and_examples.example: The two governments have agreed to engage in a dialogue to solve the problem.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: control or have a lot of influence over sb. / sth., esp. in an unpleasant way 支配；控制；左右；影响
explanations_and_examples.example: The industry is dominated by five multinational companies.

explanations_and_examples.explanation:
【vt.】
use machines to make goods or materials, usu. in large numbers or amounts （用机器大量）生产，制造
explanations_and_examples.example: It is a company that manufactures drugs.

explanations_and_examples.explanation:
【n.】
[U] the process of making goods or materials using machines, usu. in large numbers or amounts （大量商品的）生产，制造
explanations_and_examples.example: Cost will determine the methods of manufacture.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the process or business of producing goods in factories 制造；制造业
explanations_and_examples.example: Thousands of jobs had been lost in manufacturing.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [vt.]gather in crops 收割
explanations_and_examples.example: Farmers here still plant and harvest their crops by hand.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [n.][C, U] the process or period of gathering in crops 收割；收获季节
explanations_and_examples.example: The drought has made farmers anxious about the harvest.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (of fruit or crops) fully grown and ready to eat （水果或庄稼）成熟的
explanations_and_examples.example: Those tomatoes aren't ripe yet —— they're still green.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) without limits, edges, or ends 无限的
explanations_and_examples.example: Her fellow members marveled at her seemingly infinite energy.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) very great in amount or degree （数量或程度上）极大的
explanations_and_examples.example: There was an infinite variety of drinks to choose from.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (of a message) being received rather than sent （消息）接收到的
explanations_and_examples.example: My email box is flooded with incoming messages when a school year begins.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) relating to mobile phones and similar technology 与移动电话等技术有关的
explanations_and_examples.example: Over half of the country's e-commerce is now conducted on mobile devices.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) able to be moved from one place to another 可移动的
explanations_and_examples.example: The seats in the classroom are not mobile.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: deal with 处理；应付
explanations_and_examples.example: If you can't handle the job, I'll ask someone else to do it.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a list of tasks that need to be done 待办清单
explanations_and_examples.example: I'll take a moment away from my to-do list and think about my dream holiday.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: as is certain to happen 不可避免地；必然地
explanations_and_examples.example: One's accent inevitably gives away their place of origin.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) give too much of a thing to sb. 压垮；使应接不暇
explanations_and_examples.example: We were overwhelmed by requests for information.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) have a very strong emotional effect on sb. （感情上）使（某人）感到不能自持，使不知所措
explanations_and_examples.example: She was overwhelmed by the need to talk to someone.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: having a definite limit or fixed size 有限的；有限制的
explanations_and_examples.example: Every computer has a finite amount of memory.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: show or prove sth. clearly 说明；证明；论证；证实
explanations_and_examples.example: Hitchcock's films demonstrate that a British filmmaker could learn from Hollywood.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (of a situation) strange or amusing because it is very different from what you expect （情况）出乎意料的，令人啼笑皆非的
explanations_and_examples.example: It's ironic that she became a teacher —— she used to hate school.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a person who studies or writes about economics 经济学家
[sing.] a situation in which there is not enough of sth. 不足；短缺
explanations_and_examples.example: Many college graduates hunt for jobs in large cities owing to the scarcity of opportunities in small towns.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) sth. that you have promised or agreed to do, or that you have to do 已承诺（或同意）的事；不得不做的事
explanations_and_examples.example: Women often have to strike a balance between work and their family commitments.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) a promise to do sth. or to behave in a particular way 承诺
explanations_and_examples.example: Alice doesn't want to make a big emotional commitment to Steve at the moment.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] the thing that you think is most important and that needs attention before anything else 优先处理的事；当务之急
explanations_and_examples.example: The customer is high on our list of priority.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) treat sth. as being more important than other things 优先考虑；优先处理
explanations_and_examples.example: The company has failed to prioritise safety.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) determine the order for dealing with a series of items or tasks according to their relative importance 确定优先次序
explanations_and_examples.example: You should make a list of all the jobs you have to do and prioritise them.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: extremely important because it will affect other things 至关重要的；关键性的
explanations_and_examples.example: This aid money is crucial to the government's economic policies.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) make sb. share a particular feeling 使感染（某种感情）；影响
explanations_and_examples.example: The panic in the mother's voice infected her children.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) give sb. a disease 传染
explanations_and_examples.example: People with the virus may feel perfectly well, but they can still infect others.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] free time 空闲；闲暇
explanations_and_examples.example: Most people only have a limited amount of leisure time.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) the process of improving or becoming stronger again 改善；复苏
explanations_and_examples.example: The economy is showing signs of recovery.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) a return to a normal state of health, mind, or strength 恢复；康复
explanations_and_examples.example: It is hoped that Lawrence can make a full recovery from the operation.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) a sudden increase in the number of times that sth. bad happens （坏事的突然）泛滥，蔓延
explanations_and_examples.example: Can anything be done about this unhappiness epidemic?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) a widespread occurrence of an infectious disease in a community at a particular time （传染病的）流行，传播
explanations_and_examples.example: A flu epidemic is sweeping through the United States this winter.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) being the best or most extreme example of its kind 最好的；极端的
explanations_and_examples.example: This race will be the ultimate test of your skill.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) happening at the end of a long process 最后的；终极的
explanations_and_examples.example: My manager will make the ultimate decision about whom to employ.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the social or professional position of sb. / sth. in relation to others 地位；身份；职位
explanations_and_examples.example: Doctors have traditionally enjoyed high social status.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) sth. that shows a particular quality 象征
explanations_and_examples.example: His gun was a badge of power for him.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) a small piece of metal, cloth, plastic with a picture or words on it, worn to show rank, membership of a group, support for a political idea, etc. 徽章；证章
explanations_and_examples.example: He pulled out a badge and said he was a police officer.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sth. that can be regarded as a sign of sth. else 指示物
explanations_and_examples.example: All the main economic indicators suggest that trade is improving.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: completely stupid or unreasonable 荒唐的；愚蠢的
explanations_and_examples.example: It seems quite absurd to expect anyone to drive for three hours just for a 20-minute meeting.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 锁匠
[C] an amount of money paid for a piece of work or a service 报酬；服务费
explanations_and_examples.example: Does the bank charge a fee for setting up an account?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (not in passive) say that you are annoyed, not satisfied, or unhappy about sth./ sb. 抱怨；不满；发牢骚
explanations_and_examples.example: Residents are complaining because traffic in this area has increased.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: get back sth. you no longer have, esp. an ability or a quality 重新获得
explanations_and_examples.example: She paused on the edge, trying to regain her balance.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] (~ to) the means or opportunity to approach or enter a place 接近；进入
explanations_and_examples.example: The police managed to gain access to the house through an upstairs window.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: walk somewhere in a slow, relaxed way 散步；闲逛
explanations_and_examples.example: We were strolling along, laughing and joking.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【ad.】without hurrying 不慌不忙地
explanations_and_examples.example: We walked leisurely into the hotel.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【a.】unhurried or relaxed 不慌不忙的
explanations_and_examples.example: After getting up, we had a leisurely breakfast at our hotel.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 溃疡
[C] 手指甲
[U] cruel or violent treatment of sb. 虐待
explanations_and_examples.example: The woman suffered years of physical abuse.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (infml.) a person who is not strong, brave, or confident 懦夫；窝囊废
explanations_and_examples.example: The more she called her son a wimp, the less confident he became.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] (AmE baggage) the cases, bags, etc. that you carry when you are traveling 行李
explanations_and_examples.example: We dropped our luggage off at our hotel and went sightseeing.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: almost 几乎；差不多
explanations_and_examples.example: She blamed me for practically every mistake in the report.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U, sing.] unnecessary excitement, worry, or activity 无谓的激动（或忧虑、活动）；大惊小怪
explanations_and_examples.example: We tried to arrange a ceremony with as little fuss as possible.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【v.】become or make sth. full of folds or lines （使）变皱；起皱
explanations_and_examples.example: My dress got all crushed in my suitcase.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【vt.】press or squeeze sth. so hard that it is damaged or injured, or loses its shape 压坏；压伤；挤压变形
explanations_and_examples.example: The car was completely crushed under the truck.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U, sing.] the type of person you are, including your character, your typical behavior, your abilities, etc. 自身；本身；自己；自我
explanations_and_examples.example: Paula seemed to be her usual cheerful self a week after she came back home.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a secret plan made by two or more people to do sth. harmful or illegal 密谋；阴谋
explanations_and_examples.example: He was charged with conspiracy to commit criminal damage.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a company that takes passengers and goods to different places by plane 航空公司
explanations_and_examples.example: I won't fly with an airline that has a bad safety record.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make sb. feel ashamed, nervous, or uncomfortable, esp. in front of other people （尤指在社交场合）使尴尬，使窘迫
explanations_and_examples.example: He didn't want to embarrass her by asking questions.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] a feeling of being nervous or ashamed because of what people know or think about you 尴尬；难堪；窘迫
explanations_and_examples.example: She suffered extreme embarrassment at not knowing how to read and write.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: shy, awkward, or ashamed, esp. in a social situation 窘迫的；尴尬的
explanations_and_examples.example: The girl felt embarrassed at being the center of attention.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a long narrow passage on a train or between rooms in a building, with doors on one or both sides 走廊；通道
explanations_and_examples.example: We had to wait outside in the corridor until our names were called.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: trip or momentarily lose one's balance; almost fall 绊脚；绊跌
explanations_and_examples.example: Victor stumbled over the step as he came in.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) fill or use a space, an area, or an amount of time 使用，占用（空间、面积、时间等）
explanations_and_examples.example: The bed seemed to occupy most of the room.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) live or stay in a place 占据；居住
explanations_and_examples.example: He occupies the house without paying any rent.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: empty, with nobody living there or using it 空着的；闲置的；无人占用的
explanations_and_examples.example: I sat down at the nearest unoccupied table in the restaurant.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (~s) [pl.] (infml.) the courage and determination you need to do sth. difficult or unpleasant （做困难或不愉快的事情所需要的）勇气，魄力，决心
explanations_and_examples.example: When failure knocks you down, will you have the guts to get up and get going?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) say sth. quickly in an angry way 厉声说（话）
explanations_and_examples.example: There's no need to snap at me — it's not my fault that you lost your wallet.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) break or cause to break suddenly and completely, typically with a sharp cracking sound （使）啪的一声折断
explanations_and_examples.example: You'll snap that ruler if you bend it too far.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 3) (infml.) take a photograph （给···）拍照
explanations_and_examples.example: Dave snapped a picture of me and Lucas.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, usu. sing.] the length of time that sb. lives or that sth. lasts 终身；有生之年；存在期
explanations_and_examples.example: That large sum of money will last me a lifetime.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: manage to find time for sb. / sth. although you are very busy 为···挤出时间
explanations_and_examples.example: How can you manage to squeeze in so much work?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: do an amount of work 完成（工作）；处理（事情）
explanations_and_examples.example: We've got a lot of work to get through today.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make sb. feel worried and upset 使忧心忡忡
explanations_and_examples.example: The CEO felt weighed down by his responsibilities.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: undertake a task or responsibility, esp. a difficult one 接受（工作）；承担（责任）
explanations_and_examples.example: Don't take on too much work — the extra cash isn't worth it.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: be in a particular situation, state, or place after a series of events, esp. when you did not plan it （尤指经历一系列意外后）最终处于，到头来
explanations_and_examples.example: He came round for a coffee and we ended up having a meal together.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: add sth. at no extra cost 额外赠送
explanations_and_examples.example: Buy this book and we throw in a CD.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: to some degree, but not completely 在某种程度上；部分地
explanations_and_examples.example: Their harmonious relationship resulted in part from their similar goals.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (of an aircraft, etc.) leave the ground and begin to fly 起飞
explanations_and_examples.example: I felt quite excited when the plane took off from Heathrow.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: complain or become angry about sth., esp. when this is not necessary （因某事）大吵大闹，大惊小怪
explanations_and_examples.example: The soup is just a bit salty. I don't know why you're making such a fuss about it.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: arrive, esp. at the place where sb. is waiting for you 到达（尤指有人在等候之处）
explanations_and_examples.example: We had 200 people show up for the conference.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: succeed in getting somewhere in time for sth. or when this is difficult （尤指在困难情况下）准时到达，赶上
explanations_and_examples.example: You can still make it to the railway station if you set out right away.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: before sth. happens or is expected to happen 预先；提前
explanations_and_examples.example: I should warn you in advance that I'm not a very good dancer.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 塞德希尔 • 穆来纳森（美国芝加哥大学经济学教授）
埃尔达尔•沙菲尔（美国普林斯顿大学行为科学和公共政策教授）
索尔斯坦•凡勃伦（美国经济学家、社会学家）
丹•艾瑞里（美国杜克大学行为经济学教授）
宰赫兰（沙特阿拉伯东部城市）
沙特阿拉伯（亚洲西南部国家）
拉瓜迪亚机场（位于美国纽约市）
奥黑尔国际机场（位于美国芝加哥市）
芝加哥（美国中西部城市）
fight sb. by holding them and pulling or pushing them （与某人）摔跤，扭打
explanations_and_examples.example: The two men wrestled with each other, and it was hard to tell who would win.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] the final result of a discussion, war, etc. — used esp. when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens （讨论、战争等无法预知的）结果、后果
explanations_and_examples.example: People who had heard the evidence at the trial were surprised at the outcome.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【v.】(also 'tense up') make your muscles tight and stiff, or become tight and stiff 使（肌肉）绷紧；僵硬
explanations_and_examples.example: Every time the phone rang, she tensed up, being afraid to hear the bad news.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【a.】making you feel nervous and not relaxed, usu. because you are worried about what is going to happen 令人紧张的；令人不安的；令人着急的
explanations_and_examples.example: There was a tense silence as everyone waited for his reaction.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【v.】try very hard to do sth. using all your strength or ability 使劲；竭力；用尽全力
explanations_and_examples.example: She was straining to keep her head above the water.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【vt.】injure a muscle or part of your body by using it too much or making it work too hard 拉伤；扭伤
explanations_and_examples.example: I've strained a muscle in my leg and I have to go to hospital.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 腕（关节）
explanations_and_examples.example: He grasped her wrist with his free hand.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: smile widely 露齿而笑；咧着嘴笑
explanations_and_examples.example: He walked out of the pool, grinning widely.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (~s) [pl.] the period of your life when you are between 13 and 19 years old 青少年时期（13 到 19 岁之间的阶段）
explanations_and_examples.example: She was in her teens when she met her boyfriend who became her husband.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) (AmE, infml.) a teenager （青）少年；十几岁的孩子
explanations_and_examples.example: In real life, every teen can, and should, make their own decision.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: physically strong and good at sport 强壮的；擅长运动的
explanations_and_examples.example: I am not a brave man, nor am I athletic.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the ability to play sports or do physical activities well 运动能力
explanations_and_examples.example: Except for the second game he seemed to be in control and showed some great athleticism.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【vi.】breathe quickly in a way that can be heard because you are having difficulty breathing （由于呼吸困难而）急促吸气
explanations_and_examples.example: Brendan climbed slowly, gasping for breath.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【v.】breathe in suddenly in a way that can be heard, esp. because you are surprised or in pain （尤因惊讶或疼痛而）大声吸气，倒抽气
explanations_and_examples.example: The visitors gasped at the wonderful view.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past 回想，回忆起（某事物）
explanations_and_examples.example: Henry recalled that he first met Pollard during a business trip to Washington.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: cut an article or picture from a newspaper, magazine, etc. （从报纸、杂志等上）剪下
explanations_and_examples.example: He showed me a cartoon clipped from a newspaper.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] an article or picture that has been cut out of a newspaper or magazine 剪报
explanations_and_examples.example: He searched through piles of letters and clippings for his mother's letter.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: draw a line under a word, sentence, etc. to show that it is important 在···之下画线（以示重要）
explanations_and_examples.example: Please underline all the noun clauses in the reading passage.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a strong hard hat that soldiers, motorcycle riders, the police, etc. wear to protect their heads 头盔；钢盔；安全帽
explanations_and_examples.example: Protective helmets must be worn on the construction site.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: fight or struggle with sb., holding them tightly 扭打；搏斗
explanations_and_examples.example: Two men didn't stop grappling with a guard at the door until the police came.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) sth. that you do regularly and in the same way each time 惯例；老规矩；例行公事
explanations_and_examples.example: He lights his cigar after getting up every morning and this ritual has not changed for many years.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, in order to mark an important religious or social occasion （为纪念重要宗教或社会事件举行的）仪式，典礼
explanations_and_examples.example: The lady of the house still performs the ritual of lighting candles at dinner.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: having or displaying a strong desire to be more successful than others 好竞争的；求胜心切的
explanations_and_examples.example: I could never play team sports 一 I lack the competitive spirit.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 手掌；掌部
turn a part of your body around or change your position by turning 扭动（身体）
explanations_and_examples.example: He twisted his head slightly and looked up at her.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) if you wrap your arms, legs, or fingers around sth., you use them to hold it （用手臂、腿或手指）围住（某物）
explanations_and_examples.example: He wrapped his arms around her, unwilling to leave.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) (also 'wrap up') put paper or cloth over sth. to cover it （用纸或布）包，裹（某物）
explanations_and_examples.example: The present was beautifully wrapped in gold paper.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, usu. sing.] the way you hold sth. tightly, or your ability to do this 紧握；紧抓
explanations_and_examples.example: Hold the microphone in a firm grip and keep it still.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 肘
explanations_and_examples.example: He rested one elbow on the wall as he spoke.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (also 'indent') a cut into the surface or edge of sth. 凹口；凹陷；缺口
explanations_and_examples.example: The kid made an indentation in the center of each cookie.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) if clothes are itchy, they make your skin feel slightly unpleasant, so that you want to rub your skin with your nails （衣服）令人发痒的
explanations_and_examples.example: The shirt is itchy and uncomfortable.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) if part of your body is itchy, it feels slightly unpleasant and you want to rub it with your nails 发痒的
explanations_and_examples.example: My eyes sometimes get red and itchy in the summer.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] failure to win or succeed 失败
explanations_and_examples.example: She was a woman who hated to admit defeat.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [v.]stop resisting sb. / sth.; agree to do sth. that you do not want to do 屈服；让步
explanations_and_examples.example: He reluctantly yielded to their demands.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [vt.]produce a result, answer, or piece of information 产生，得出（结果、答案或消息）
explanations_and_examples.example: Our research has only recently begun to yield important results.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) firmly held in a particular position and not moving or shaking 稳定的；牢固的；不摇晃的
explanations_and_examples.example: Keep the camera steady while you take a picture.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) developing gradually or without stopping, and not likely to change 平稳的；持续的；逐渐的
explanations_and_examples.example: The study also notes a steady drop in the number of college students taking science courses.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: in a way that involves shaking or moving in a way you cannot control 颤抖地；抖动地
explanations_and_examples.example: I walked unsteadily to another room and looked outside.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used to describe sth. that is surprising because you were not expecting it 想不到的；意外的；突然的
explanations_and_examples.example: The experiment with new methods produced some unexpected results.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] the act of taking sb.'s right hand and shaking it, which people do when they meet or leave each other or when they have reached an agreement 握手
explanations_and_examples.example: He greeted me with a firm handshake.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: take air, liquid, etc. into your mouth by making your lips form a small hole and using the muscles of your mouth to pull it in 吸；吮；啜
explanations_and_examples.example: He sucked hard for air to keep breathing.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (~ oneself / sb. for) mentally or physically prepare yourself or sb. else for sth. unpleasant that is going to happen （使）准备迎接（令人不快的事）
explanations_and_examples.example: Nancy braced herself for the inevitable arguments during the meeting.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【n.】[C] the act of holding sb. close to you, esp. as a sign of love 拥抱
explanations_and_examples.example: They held each other in a tender embrace.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【v.】put your arms around sb. and hold them in a friendly or loving way 抱；拥抱
explanations_and_examples.example: The couple were sort of crying for joy and embracing each other.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 喉咙；咽喉
[U] the state of feeling sad 悲伤；悲痛
explanations_and_examples.example: It was with great sadness that we learned of his death.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) a low table with a mirror where one sits while applying makeup 梳妆台
explanations_and_examples.example: Mary took the watch out of her dresser and put it on.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) a piece of furniture with drawers for storing clothes, sometimes with a mirror on top 衣橱
explanations_and_examples.example: He put the pants in the dresser and went to bed.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) hang sth. loosely （松松垮垮地）挂，吊，悬
explanations_and_examples.example: She likes to wear a belt slung around her waist.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) throw or put sth. somewhere with a careless movement and some force （随意而稍用力地）拐，掷，抛
explanations_and_examples.example: He stood up and slung his gun over his shoulder.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: bigger than usual or too big 大于一般的；太大的
explanations_and_examples.example: I'm sorry. Your parcel is a bit oversized.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [pl.] 太阳镜；墨镜
(only before noun) used when you want to emphasize that you mean all of a group, period of time, amount, etc. 全部的；整个的
explanations_and_examples.example: He was so tired that he slept through the entire movie.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (AmE) a structure built onto the front or back entrance of a house, with a floor and a roof but no walls （房屋前后的）游廊，走廊；阳台
2) (BrE) an entrance covered by a roof outside the front door of a house or church （房子或教堂前门外有顶的）入口，门廊
[C] a small box made of cardboard or plastic that contains food or a drink 硬纸盒；塑料盒
explanations_and_examples.example: She was so thirsty that she drank a carton of orange juice.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (rewound, rewound) make a cassette tape or video go backward in order to see or hear it again 倒回（录音带或录像带）
explanations_and_examples.example: He rewound the tape and replayed a few pieces.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: drink sth. slowly, taking very small mouthfuls 小口地喝；抿；呷
explanations_and_examples.example: She was sitting at the table sipping her coffee.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (pl. patios) a flat hard area near a house, where people sit outside （房屋外面的）露台，平台
[C] 海鸥
[U] the railway system 铁路系统
[C, U] a moral or legal duty to do sth. （道义或法律上的）义务，职责，责任
explanations_and_examples.example: Employers have an obligation to treat all employees equally.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make sb. feel calmer and less worried or frightened about a problem or situation 使安心；使放心；使消除疑虑
explanations_and_examples.example: He tried to reassure me, but I still felt anxious.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: written by hand, not printed 手写的
explanations_and_examples.example: Would you like the essay typed or handwritten?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: without feeling ashamed of your bad behavior although other people think you should be ashamed 无耻地；不知羞耻地
explanations_and_examples.example: He shamelessly abandoned the project when he realized he would not gain any benefits from it.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (not before noun) unable to control your behavior, speech, etc. because you have drunk too much alcohol 喝醉的
explanations_and_examples.example: David got drunk and I had to take him home and put him to bed.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a storm with thunder and lightning 雷暴
explanations_and_examples.example: Eventually, the thunderstorm stopped and we saw a beautiful rainbow in the sky.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: hold sb. / sth. very close to you with your arms around them, esp. to show that you love them （尤指表示喜爱而）抱，拥抱，搂抱
explanations_and_examples.example: Dawn and her boyfriend were cuddling on the sofa.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (be ~ on / upon) be directly affected or decided by sth. else 取决于某物
explanations_and_examples.example: Your pay is dependent on how much you produce.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) needing sb. / sth. in order to survive or be successful 依靠的；依赖的
explanations_and_examples.example: You can't be dependent on your parents all your life.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: let sb. get into your car, boat, etc. and take them somewhere 搭载；接载
explanations_and_examples.example: I'll pick you up at the station and take you to the dinner party afterward.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: work effectively toward countering or defeating sb. / sth. 有效地对抗；击败
explanations_and_examples.example: I heard that pepper spray works well against bears.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if an aircraft or spacecraft lifts off, it leaves the ground and rises into the air （飞机）起飞；（航天器）升空
explanations_and_examples.example: The aeroplane lifted off at noon for New York with more than 100 passengers.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: not go to bed at the time you would normally go to bed 熬夜；深夜不睡觉
explanations_and_examples.example: With so much homework to do, I will have to stay up late tonight.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: accept sth. even though it is not the best, or not what you really want 勉强接受；将就
explanations_and_examples.example: They want $2,500 for it, but they might settle for $2,000.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: near enough to walk to easily 在步行距离之内
explanations_and_examples.example: She used to live within walking distance of her children.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if sth. is on your mind, you keep thinking or worrying about it 挂在心上的；惦念的
explanations_and_examples.example: He looked as though he had something on his mind.

children.word: at the top of one's lungs

explanations_and_examples.explanation: as loudly as possible 尽量大声地；放声地
explanations_and_examples.example: He came running up to me screaming at the top of his lungs, "I love you!"

explanations_and_examples.explanation: lie or sit very close to sb. / sth. 偎依
explanations_and_examples.example: We cuddled up together to keep out the cold.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 网飞（在线影片租赁提供商，总部位于美国加利福尼亚州）
(~ through) look through the pages of a book, magazine, etc. without a particular purpose, just looking at the most interesting parts 随意翻阅，浏览（书刊等）
explanations_and_examples.example: I was browsing through a magazine at the station bookstall when I saw Susan.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U, sing.] a strong feeling of wanting sb. / sth. 渴望；盼望
explanations_and_examples.example: Spending the holiday alone in a foreign country, she had a sudden desperate longing for home.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a long passage between rows of seats in a church, plane, theater, etc., or between rows of shelves in a shop 通道；过道
explanations_and_examples.example: Madam, would you like a window seat or a seat next to the aisle?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make sth. move quickly and suddenly, esp. with a quick movement of the hand （尤指用手快速地）轻击， 轻拍，轻拂，轻弹
explanations_and_examples.example: The kid flicked the screen of the iPad to find something interesting.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: in a way that is unwilling to keep still or stay where you are, esp. because you are nervous or bored （尤指因紧张或厌烦而）不安宁地，烦躁地，不耐烦地
explanations_and_examples.example: He stood up and moved about in the room restlessly.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (usu. after another noun) a feeling of not wanting to do a particular activity any longer because you have done too much of it 厌倦
explanations_and_examples.example: Too many requests for aid can cause compassion (同情心) fatigue.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) very great tiredness 疲劳；疲乏；劳累
explanations_and_examples.example: He was suffering from mental and physical fatigue because of his father's illness.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) a state of being unable to take action, make decisions, or operate normally 不知所措；（行动、 决策、运行等）瘫痪，停顿
explanations_and_examples.example: The country was on the verge of complete paralysis due to the strike.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) the loss of the ability to move all or part of your body or feel things in it 瘫痪；麻痹
explanations_and_examples.example: A stroke can cause paralysis and difficulties with speech in the patient.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 驴
(not before noun) not able to do sth. 无能力（做某事）的
explanations_and_examples.example: Many teenagers feel that they are unable to talk to their parents about their problems.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U]（作动物饲料用的）干草，饲草
(~ about / of) talk too proudly about your abilities, achievements, or possessions 夸口；夸耀；吹嘘
explanations_and_examples.example: Andrew often boasts of his success in investing in real estate.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 指尖
[C, U] when you do not understand what is happening or what sth. means because it is not clear 困惑；不确定；混乱
explanations_and_examples.example: There is a great deal of confusion about how the new machine works.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (fml.) if you replicate sb.'s work, a scientific study, etc., you do it again, or try to get the same result again 重做；重复（某项科学研究）；复证（某个结果）
explanations_and_examples.example: There is a need for further research to replicate the findings of Professor Thompson and his team.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] an amount of money paid regularly by the government or company to sb. who does not work anymore, for example because they have reached the age when people stop working or because they are ill 养老金；退休金
explanations_and_examples.example: If you are self-employed, can you enjoy a pension after retirement?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) make sb. want to achieve sth. and make them willing to work hard in order to do this 激发；激励；促动
explanations_and_examples.example: A good teacher has to be able to motivate their students.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) be the reason why sb. does sth. 成为···的动机
explanations_and_examples.example: Was he motivated by a desire for power?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make sb. less eager to work or study 使人失去动力；使人消极
explanations_and_examples.example: The new policy can create insecurity and demotivate staff.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] all the connections between computers in different places, considered as a real place where information, messages, pictures, etc. exist 网络空间
explanations_and_examples.example: The laws of privacy and copyright still apply in cyberspace.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: v.(also 'stack up') make things into a neat pile, or form a neat pile （使）整齐地堆起；摞起
explanations_and_examples.example: The shop assistants price all kinds of ice cream before stacking them in the freezer.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: n.[C] a neat pile of things 一叠；一堆；一摞
explanations_and_examples.example: Next to the bottles was a tall stack of plastic cups.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] (written) a general area of knowledge, activity, or thought （知识、活动、思想的）领域，范围
explanations_and_examples.example: This concept first appeared in the realm of science fiction a hundred years ago.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make sb. feel slightly angry and unhappy about sth. 使恼怒；使生气
explanations_and_examples.example: What annoyed him most was that he had received no apology.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: making you feel slightly angry 讨厌的；令人气恼的
explanations_and_examples.example: It is annoying that he didn't tell us anything about the plan before.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the fact of being more powerful, more important, or more noticeable than other people or things 优势；显要；突出
explanations_and_examples.example: TV has had dominance over other media for many decades in broadcasting news.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) the way in which information is stored on a computer （计算机信息存储）格式
explanations_and_examples.example: These images are stored in a digital format within the database.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) the general arrangement, plan, design, etc. of sth. 总体安排；计划；设计
explanations_and_examples.example: The format of the new quiz show has proved popular.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [sing.] a quick increase of business activity （生意）繁荣，兴旺，激增
explanations_and_examples.example: The economic boom in the past decade has created many job opportunities in this country.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] sth. you do in order to punish sb. who has harmed or offended you 报复；报仇
explanations_and_examples.example: Caesar returned to Rome to take a terrible revenge on his enemies.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (BrE analogue) a thing that is similar to another thing 相似物；类似情况
explanations_and_examples.example: No artificial model can ever be a perfect analog of nature itself.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [U] a quality that makes people like sb. / sth. 感染力；吸引力
explanations_and_examples.example: The long beach and clear water are the particular appeal of this island.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [C] an urgent request for sth. important 呼吁；恳求
explanations_and_examples.example: The missing girl was found yesterday after a nationwide appeal for help.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: describe sth. correctly and thoroughly, and say what standards, limits, qualities, etc. it has that make it different from other things 确定；说明；界定
explanations_and_examples.example: It is vital for the seller to have the ability to define buyers' needs.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: reduce sth. in amount, degree, strength, etc., or become less 降低；减少
explanations_and_examples.example: I think we should lower the price to make our product more competitive.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [U] (fml.) when sb. likes sb. / sth. and thinks that they are good 赞许；赞成；同意
explanations_and_examples.example: The children longed for a sign of approval from the teacher for what they had done.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [C, U] when a plan, decision, or person is officially accepted 批准；认可
explanations_and_examples.example: It is just two months since we received official approval to go ahead with the project.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 拳头
too strong to be destroyed or defeated 不可战胜的；无敌的
explanations_and_examples.example: She seemed nearly invincible on the tennis court this year.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a room or hall at the entrance to a public building （公共建筑物入口处的）休息厅，门厅
(only before noun) tall with many levels 高耸的；高层的
explanations_and_examples.example: Their office is in a high-rise building in the center of the city.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the time before it gets dark when the sky is becoming less bright 黄昏；傍晚
explanations_and_examples.example: She likes to sit in the garden at dusk, listening to her favorite band.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) if people, vehicles, goods, etc. trickle somewhere, they move there slowly in small groups or amounts （人、车辆、货物等）缓慢而零星地移动
explanations_and_examples.example: A few fans started to trickle into the stadium where the concert was to be held.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) if liquid trickles somewhere, it flows slowly in drops or in a thin stream 滴；淌；涓涓地流
explanations_and_examples.example: She could feel the sweat trickling down her back.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (also 'scribble down') write sth. quickly and untidily 潦草地写
explanations_and_examples.example: You can scribble your own ideas in the blank areas provided.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) a sign in the shape of an arrow, used to show direction （指示方向的）箭号，箭头（符号）
explanations_and_examples.example: Follow the arrows on the ground and you can find the school library easily.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) a weapon usually made from a thin straight piece of wood with a sharp point at one end, that you shoot with a bow 箭；矢
explanations_and_examples.example: Cupid shot an arrow at William and he fell in love with Joanna at first sight.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) the act of trying to develop ideas and think of ways to solve problems 头脑风暴
explanations_and_examples.example: Unless we have a brainstorm, I don't see how we're going to get out of this situation.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) (AmE) a sudden clever idea 灵感；突然想到的妙计
explanations_and_examples.example: Kate had a sudden brainstorm after days of deep thinking.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: at a middle point in space or time between two things （空间或时间的）中间（的），半途（的）
explanations_and_examples.example: We stopped at the highway service area halfway through the journey for a drink and some rest.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) give professional advice to a person, organization, or company for a fee 当顾问
explanations_and_examples.example: She consults on law for a living after she graduated with a master's degree.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) ask for information or advice from sb. because it is their job to know sth. 咨询；请教
explanations_and_examples.example: As with any medicine, please consult your doctor before taking.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 牡蛎；蚝
1) a set of reasons that show that sth. is true or untrue, right or wrong, etc. 论点；论据
explanations_and_examples.example: We need to provide a convincing argument as to why the system should be changed.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) a situation in which two or more people disagree, often angrily 争论；争吵；争辩
explanations_and_examples.example: There have been a lot of arguments about who was responsible for the accident.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the activity of controlling and organizing the work that a company or organization does （对公司或组织的）经营，管理
explanations_and_examples.example: The company went bankrupt due to a lack of management skills.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) include different areas of activity, groups, time, etc. 包括，跨越（不同的活动领域、团体、时间等）
explanations_and_examples.example: She is experimenting with a new style which straddles classic and modern art.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) sit or stand with your legs on either side of sb. / sth. 跨坐；跨立
explanations_and_examples.example: The photo shows him dressed in leather, straddling a motorbike.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (~ in) use a lot of time, effort, etc. or spend money in order to make sth. succeed 投入（大量时间、精力、金钱等以成就某事）
explanations_and_examples.example: Elizabeth finds it necessary to invest a lot of time in learning new skills.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) buy shares, property, or goods because you hope that the value will increase and you can make a profit 投资
explanations_and_examples.example: I've got a few thousand dollars I'm looking to invest.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (fml.) (only before noun) relating to the existence of humans or to existentialism 关于人类存在的；存在主义的
explanations_and_examples.example: He holds the existential notion that man is in control of his own life.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: in a way that you feel you want to thank sb. because of sth. kind that they have done, or to show this feeling 感谢地；感激地
explanations_and_examples.example: All contributions to the disaster areas will be gratefully received.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a manager in an organization or company who helps make important decisions （机构或公司的）主管，经理
explanations_and_examples.example: As an executive, he made some important decisions and gradually led the company to the track of rapid progress.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: relating to education 教育的
explanations_and_examples.example: This institution offers a wide range of educational and sports activities.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: sth. that is abundant exists or is available in large quantities so that there is more than enough 充裕的；丰富的
explanations_and_examples.example: This country has an abundant supply of natural resources.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a discussion in which people who are affected by or involved in sth. can give their opinions 商量，磋商；咨询
explanations_and_examples.example: The decision was reached after consultation with her parents and teachers.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sth. that you think is true although you have no definite proof 假定；假设
explanations_and_examples.example: You are making an assumption that might not be true.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sth. that you need to have in order to live 必需品
explanations_and_examples.example: A lot of families could not even afford to buy the basic necessities of life during that period of time.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: in a way that facts and ideas are connected in a correct way in the thinking process 按照逻辑地；合乎逻辑地
explanations_and_examples.example: At the meeting, Sarah presented her ideas about the new product clearly and logically.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: willingly stop having sth. you want or doing sth. you like in order to get sth. more important 牺牲；献出
explanations_and_examples.example: He sacrificed a promising career in his 30s to look after his kids.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) give up sb. / sth., esp. because you are forced to （被迫）放弃
explanations_and_examples.example: People believed that Bayer has surrendered his artistic identity in his later films.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) say officially that you want to stop fighting, because you realize that you cannot win 投降
explanations_and_examples.example: The rebel soldiers were forced to surrender.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) not knowing what to do in a particular situation 不知所措的；（为某事）犯愁的
explanations_and_examples.example: If you're stuck for something to do tonight, come out with us.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) impossible or unable to move from a particular position 卡住的；无法移动的；动不了的
explanations_and_examples.example: Sara tried to open the window but it was stuck.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: at exactly the same time 同时发生地；同步地
explanations_and_examples.example: The concert will be broadcast simultaneously on television and radio.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: two statements, beliefs, etc. that are contradictory are different and therefore cannot both be true or correct 矛盾的；抵触的
explanations_and_examples.example: The witnesses gave two completely contradictory accounts, so we don't know which one should be trusted.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (infml.) continue doing sth. the way you did or planned to do before 继续做（使用）；不放弃
explanations_and_examples.example: Let's stick with the original plans we decided together.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: have knowledge or information ready and available to use very easily 手头有某物（可供随时使用）；对某物了如指掌
explanations_and_examples.example: We have all the facts and latest figures about the application at our fingertips.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if sth. sets in, esp. sth. unpleasant, it begins and seems likely to continue for a long time （尤指不愉快的事）开始，来临
explanations_and_examples.example: Winter seems to be setting in rather early this year.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used to tell sb. that they can achieve whatever they want 可以随心所欲；想要什么就能得到什么
explanations_and_examples.example: With a doctoral degree and a mathematical talent, the world is her oyster.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: manage to do sth. or see sb., even though you have a lot of other things to do 安排时间做（某事）；安排时间见（某人）；找出···的时间
explanations_and_examples.example: I wanted to fit in a swim before breakfast, since I would be fully occupied the whole day.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if you say sth. in passing, you mention it while you are mainly talking about sth. else （在谈论别的事情时）顺便说起某事物，附带提及某事物
explanations_and_examples.example: Sampson mentioned in passing Emma's strange behavior at yesterday's party.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if sth. happens by default, it happens because you did not do anything to change it 由于没有采取行动（而发生某事）
explanations_and_examples.example: I became a teacher by default rather than by design.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: become involved in an activity, discussion, or disagreement, sometimes in order to stop trouble 介入；干涉；插手
explanations_and_examples.example: An outside buyer has stepped in to save the company from going out of business.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 印度洋
苹果音乐（苹果公司推出的流媒体音乐服务）
[C] (also 'alleyway') a narrow street between or behind buildings, not usually used by cars 小巷； 胡同
explanations_and_examples.example: A narrow alley led up between the houses to the main street.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] the way in which the parts of sth. such as the page of a book, a garden, or a building are arranged 布局；布置；设计；安排
explanations_and_examples.example: All the flats in the building have the same layout.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (BrE neighbourhood) a district or an area of a town 街区；城区
explanations_and_examples.example: Jessica and Jason grew up in the same neighborhood of Boston.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the state of feeling excited 激动；兴奋；刺激
explanations_and_examples.example: The children were filled with excitement at the thought of visiting Disneyland.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: having energy and determination 精神饱满的；生气勃勃的；有决心的
explanations_and_examples.example: At the end of the day, the usually cheerful and spirited girl was worn out.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] （铺屋顶的）瓦，瓦片
(~ of) very typical of a particular thing or of sb.'s character 典型的；独特的
explanations_and_examples.example: Personality is often defined as an individual's characteristic way of thinking, feeling, and behaving.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make sb. feel admiration and respect 使钦佩；使留下深刻印象
explanations_and_examples.example: None of the people I've interviewed so far has impressed me.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【vt.】be the thing that makes sb. / sth. different or special 使有区别；使有特色
explanations_and_examples.example: The factor that distinguishes this company from its competitors is customer service.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【v.】recognize and understand the difference between two or more things or people 区分； 辨别
explanations_and_examples.example: At what age are children able to distinguish between right and wrong?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] the way in which two facts, ideas, events, people, etc. are related to each other, and one is affected or caused by the other 联系；关联
explanations_and_examples.example: There is a connection between pollution and the death of trees.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] A group of people who live together and who share the work and their possessions 群居团体；社区
explanations_and_examples.example: She went to California and joined a commune.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: shared by a group of people or animals, esp. a group who live together （为同一群体所）共有的，共用的，共享的
explanations_and_examples.example: As a student he tried communal living for a few years.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: having sth. as part of a group or set 包括···在内
explanations_and_examples.example: I've got three days' holiday including New Year's Day.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sb. from the western part of the world 西方人；西洋人；欧美人
explanations_and_examples.example: What is difficult for Westerners to understand is the real meaning of these cultural customs.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] the time at the beginning of the day when light first appears 黎明；破晓
explanations_and_examples.example: I don't think he went to sleep until dawn.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) existing, happening, or used outside, not inside a building （在）户外的；用于户外的
explanations_and_examples.example: I love outdoor activities such as walking and camping.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: happy, or behaving in a way that shows you are happy 高兴的；兴高采烈的
explanations_and_examples.example: Before the accident he had been cheerful and confident.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sb. who tries to find a suitable partner for sb. else to marry 媒人
explanations_and_examples.example: Ours, after all, was not a marriage arranged by a matchmaker or by our parents.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (BrE vendor) sb. who sells things, esp. on the street （尤指街上的）小贩
explanations_and_examples.example: He bought a copy from a newspaper vender.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (AmE) (~ up ∕ along ∕ down, etc.) ride a bicycle 骑（自行车）
explanations_and_examples.example: Andrew pedaled up the road toward the town center.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: a.】of or being a distinctive, identifying feature or characteristic 特有的；标志性的
explanations_and_examples.example: She was about to burst into her trademark laughter when her mom silenced her.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: n.】[C] a special name, sign, or word that is marked on a product to show that it is made by a particular company, that cannot be used by any other company （公司某一产品的）商标
explanations_and_examples.example: The big letter "M" is McDonald's best-known trademark.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: take sb's attention away from sth. by making them look at or listen to sth. else 分散（注意力）；使分心
explanations_and_examples.example: Try not to distract the other students.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: preventing you from concentrating on sth. 分散注意力的；使人分心的
explanations_and_examples.example: I find it too distracting to work with the television on.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (of sounds) very high （声音）很高的；尖厉的
explanations_and_examples.example: I could hear high-pitched laughter coming from the girls' bedroom.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sb. who buys and sells a particular product 交易商；贸易商
explanations_and_examples.example: She bought the painting from a Swiss art dealer two months ago.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [n.][C] the range of musical notes that sb.'s voice or a musical instrument can reach （嗓音或乐器的）音域，声区，音区
explanations_and_examples.example: Singers have to learn how to sing in the upper register.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [v.]put sb.'s / sth.'s name on an official list 记录；登记
explanations_and_examples.example: How many students have registered for English classes this semester?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make sth. have a sharper edge or point, or become sharper （使）变锋利（尖锐）
explanations_and_examples.example: Anne sharpened her pencil and got out her homework.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a person or device that makes sth. sharp 削磨的人；磨具；削具
explanations_and_examples.example: You can buy the best pencil sharpeners at low prices in our store.
