explanations_and_examples.explanation: [sing.] the short loud sound of one hard object hitting against another 硬物撞击声；咔哒声；啪嗒声
explanations_and_examples.example: I heard the clack of high heels as she crossed the yard.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make sb. feel calmer and less anxious, upset, or angry 抚慰；安慰；使平静
explanations_and_examples.example: Lucia soothed the baby by rocking him in her arms.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: making you feel calm and less nervous, worried, or upset 抚慰的；安慰的
explanations_and_examples.example: My mother had a gentle, soothing voice.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sth. that makes you notice, remember, or think about sth. 起提醒作用的事物
explanations_and_examples.example: The town wanted to forget the war but the destroyed bridge was a painful reminder.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (~ with) full of people moving about in a busy way 繁忙的；熙熙攘攘的
explanations_and_examples.example: The flower market was bustling with shoppers.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, usu. sing.] sb.'s mind, or their deepest feelings, which control their attitudes and behavior 心灵；灵魂；精神
explanations_and_examples.example: She knew, at some deep level of her psyche, that what she was doing was wrong.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: say hello to sb. or welcome them 问候；迎接；招呼
explanations_and_examples.example: She greeted each of the guests as they came through the door.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a ball of air or gas in liquid （液体中的）气泡，泡沫
explanations_and_examples.example: When water boils, bubbles rise to the surface.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: give special importance to sth. 强调；重视；着重
explanations_and_examples.example: The report emphasizes the importance of improving safety standards.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] energy and enthusiasm to make new things happen or to make things succeed 精力；活力；劲头
explanations_and_examples.example: People responded positively to Ruth's cheerfulness and dynamism.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: many times 再三地；重复地
explanations_and_examples.example: Sam was repeatedly warned not to work so hard.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sb. you work with — used esp. by professional people 同事；同僚（尤为专业人士所用）
explanations_and_examples.example: She discussed the idea with some of her colleagues.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【v. 】(fml.) refuse politely to accept or to do sth. 谢绝；婉言拒绝
explanations_and_examples.example: The Prime Minister was asked for his opinion but he declined to comment.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【vi.】decrease in quantity or importance 减少；降低
explanations_and_examples.example: Spending on information technology has started to decline in recent years.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【n. 】[U, sing.] a decrease in the quality, quantity, or importance of sth. 下降；减少；消减；衰落
explanations_and_examples.example: There has been a decline in the size of families.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a tall cup used for drinking tea, coffee, etc.（喝茶、咖啡等用的有柄的）大杯，马克杯
explanations_and_examples.example: Jake had a quick breakfast and a mug of coffee in the morning.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) happen or exist at the same time as sth. else 伴随
explanations_and_examples.example: The disease is accompanied by headache and fever.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) go somewhere with sb. 陪伴；陪同
explanations_and_examples.example: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult in these activities.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] an act of saying or showing that you will not do, give, or accept sth. 拒绝；回绝
explanations_and_examples.example: His refusal to discuss the matter made me angry.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [C] sth. that you say or do, often sth. small, to show how you feel about sb. / sth. （表明态度的）表示，姿态
explanations_and_examples.example: They sent me some flowers as a gesture of goodwill.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [C, U] a movement of part of your body, esp. your hands or head, to show what you mean or how you feel （表达意思或感觉的）手势，姿势
explanations_and_examples.example: Jim raised his hands in a despairing gesture.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (fml.) a hot or cold drink 饮料
explanations_and_examples.example: Beer is the most popular alcoholic beverage.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a greater interest in or desire for sb. / sth. than sb. / sth. else 偏爱；偏好
explanations_and_examples.example: Many people expressed a strong preference for the original plan.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) continuing or existing all through your life 终身的；毕生的
explanations_and_examples.example: She first visited Ireland when she was 10, and developed a lifelong interest in the country.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (of arguments, disagreements, etc.) very serious and unpleasant, with a lot of anger and hatred involved （争论、分歧等）激烈而不愉快的，充满愤怒与仇恨的
explanations_and_examples.example: The couple had a bitter quarrel over the division of labor.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) feeling angry, jealous, and upset because you think you have been treated unfairly 愤愤不平的；充满怨恨的
explanations_and_examples.example: I feel bitter about his behavior.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [pl.] (infml.) your relatives by marriage, esp. the father and mother of your husband or wife 姻亲（尤指公婆或岳父母）
explanations_and_examples.example: We lived with my in-laws until we had enough money to buy a house of our own.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: friendly, welcoming, and generous to visitors 好客的；殷勤的；热情友好的
explanations_and_examples.example: The local people were very kind and hospitable.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: doing what you are expected to do and behaving in a loyal and obedient way 尽责的；忠诚的；顺从的；恭敬的
explanations_and_examples.example: His dutiful secretary was always there to answer her boss' call when he needed her.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【v.】cook sth. slowly, or allow sth. to cook slowly, in liquid in a closed dish 炖；煨
explanations_and_examples.example: The meat needs to stew for two hours.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【n.】[C, U] a dish of meat and vegetables cooked slowly in liquid in a container that has a lid 炖的菜；煨的菜（有肉和蔬菜）
explanations_and_examples.example: I'm making a stew for lunch.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: in a state of showing pleasure and pride because of a victory or success （因胜利或成功而）洋洋得意地，耀武扬威地
explanations_and_examples.example: "I've got a job," she announced triumphantly.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (~ at / up / down, etc.) quickly look at sb. / sth. 一瞥；看一眼
explanations_and_examples.example: The man glanced nervously at his watch.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: containing a lot of milk 掺奶的；多乳的
explanations_and_examples.example: Water, fruit juice, and hot milky drinks are offered on planes.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a short pointed knife used as a weapon 匕首；短剑
used when you are giving your opinion or stating what is important about a situation 总的来说；从根本上
explanations_and_examples.example: Basically, we're looking for someone who can work three afternoons a week.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a person who is not accepted as a member of a society, group, etc. 外人；局外人
explanations_and_examples.example: I'm an outsider, the only foreign woman in the group.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if different people or organizations unite, or if sth. unites them, they join together in order to achieve sth. （使）联合；（使）团结
explanations_and_examples.example: We will unite in fighting crime.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (of people or groups) in agreement and working together （人或群体）和谐的，一致的，团结的
explanations_and_examples.example: We need to become a more united team.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) very important or greatly respected 很重要的；神圣的；深受尊重的
explanations_and_examples.example: Few things were sacred to Henry, but local history was one of them.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) relating to a god or religion 上帝的；神的；宗教（性）的
explanations_and_examples.example: Certain animals were considered sacred.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] the room, building, etc. where you work 工作场所
explanations_and_examples.example: How do you keep your personal problems out of the workplace?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【vt.】(infml.) quickly put sth. somewhere, usu. for a short time 迅速地放置
explanations_and_examples.example: She took out a piece of chewing gum (口香糖)and popped it in her mouth.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【vi.】come suddenly or unexpectedly out of or away from sth. （突然或出人意料地）蹦出，离开，脱落
explanations_and_examples.example: The top button popped off my shirt.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: not pleasant or enjoyable 使人不愉快的；不合意的；讨厌的
explanations_and_examples.example: Undercooked potatoes taste unpleasant and can be harmful.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C](esp. BrE) an amount of tea made at one time （茶）一次的冲泡量
explanations_and_examples.example: Nothing beats the taste of a fresh brew made from Carlisle Tea's fine quality loose-leaf teas.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: lasting or taking too long and not interesting 冗长的；啰唆的；单调乏味的；令人厌烦的
explanations_and_examples.example: We had to listen to the tedious details of his presentation.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [U] the act of recording information in a computer, book, etc. 登记；输入；录入
explanations_and_examples.example: The program is used to describe the entry of data into the network.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [C, U] the act of going into sth. 进入
explanations_and_examples.example: It was dark and their entry into the camp had gone unnoticed.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (~ in) (of a habit, attitude, etc.) that has existed for a long time and is therefore difficult to change （习惯、态度等）根深蒂固的，日久难改的
explanations_and_examples.example: The idea of doing our duty is deeply ingrained in most people.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (AmE cart) a small table on very small wheels, used for carrying or serving food or drink （运或送食物、饮料的）手推车，台车
1) (fml.) eat or drink sth. 吃；喝
explanations_and_examples.example: In order to survive, human beings need to consume food and water.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) use time, energy, goods, etc. 消耗；消费
explanations_and_examples.example: A smaller car will consume less fuel.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: ask a lot of people the same questions in order to find out what they think about a subject 对···进行民意测验（调查）
explanations_and_examples.example: Over 50% of those polled were against the proposed military action.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: almost 几乎
explanations_and_examples.example: This report says more or less the same thing as the previous one.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: put warm clothes on sb. or yourself because it is cold （因寒冷）给···穿上暖和的衣服
explanations_and_examples.example: You'll have to bundle up; it's cold outside.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: move or get somewhere 去；前往；到···地方去
explanations_and_examples.example: The team slowly made their way back to the base camp.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: give sth. to sb. else, esp. after receiving it or using it yourself 转交；（用后）递给，传给
explanations_and_examples.example: She said she'd pass the message on to the other students.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: find sb. / sth. that is difficult to find by searching or looking for information in several different places 追踪到；追查到
explanations_and_examples.example: The police have so far failed to track down the attacker.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: have an idea about who or what you want for a particular purpose 心里已有某人 / 某事物（作为···的目标选项）
explanations_and_examples.example: Have you got any particular color in mind for the bedroom?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: spend a lot of time with sb. 与···长时间待在一起
explanations_and_examples.example: The people I used to hang around with were much older than me.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make sb. / sth. lively or interesting （使）变得生动；（使）变得有趣
explanations_and_examples.example: With these pictures I hope to bring the room to life.

children.word: drive sb. crazy / nuts / mad / insane

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make sb. feel very annoyed 把某人逼疯
explanations_and_examples.example: Would you stop that humming? You're driving me crazy!

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (of a remark, etc.) have a strong effect on sb., in a way that makes them realize what the true facts of a situation are （言语等）使人豁然醒悟
explanations_and_examples.example: She saw the emotion in her father's face and knew her words had hit home.

children.word: take it upon / on oneself (to do sth.)

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (fml.) decide to do sth. without getting sb.'s permission or approval first 擅自做主做某事；自作主张做某事
explanations_and_examples.example: He took it upon himself to personally thank each person at the meeting.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: continue to exist in a different situation （在不同情况下）继续存在，保持下去
explanations_and_examples.example: Attitudes learned at home carry over into the playground.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (BrE, spoken) quickly turn on a piece of electrical equipment 迅速开启（电器）
explanations_and_examples.example: Pop on the stove with a loose fitting lid to allow steam to escape.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 紫禁城（中国明清两代的皇家宫殿）
白金汉宫（英国王室官邸，位于伦敦）
unwise, without good sense 愚蠢的；笨的
explanations_and_examples.example: It would be foolish to spend money on something you can't afford.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a place where roads, lines, etc. cross each other, esp. where two roads meet（尤指两条道路的）交叉点，十字路口；（线的）交叉点
explanations_and_examples.example: Traffic lights have been placed at all major intersections.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (fml.) meet sb. without planning to 偶然碰到（某人）
explanations_and_examples.example: I first encountered him when I was studying at Cambridge.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) experience sth., esp. problems or opposition 遇到，遭遇（尤指问题或反对）
explanations_and_examples.example: The more dangers we encounter, the harder should we push forward.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【vi.】look very carefully or hard at sth., esp. because you are having difficulty seeing it（尤指因看起来费劲而）凝视，盯着看
explanations_and_examples.example: I had been peering at a computer printout that made no sense at all.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【n.】[C, usu. pl.] (fml.) sb. of the same age, social class, etc. 同龄人；身份（或地位）相同的人
explanations_and_examples.example: Children compete to win the approval of their peers.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (esp. AmE) moving or pointing toward a higher position 向上；朝上
explanations_and_examples.example: Pointing upward, he indicated a large nest high in the tree.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a small room where you can leave your coat 衣帽间；衣帽寄存处
[C] a group of animals of one kind that live and feed together 兽群；牧群
explanations_and_examples.example: The milkman selected the spotted cows, from among a herd of 200.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a natural tendency to behave in a particular way or a natural ability to know sth., which is not learned 本能；直觉；天性
explanations_and_examples.example: Hearing the loud noise, Mary's first instinct was to hide under the blankets.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [sing.] the natural tendency in people or animals to behave or think like other people or animals 群体本能（人或动物在行为或思维上从众的自然趋势）
【vt.】control or influence sth. 支配；影响；决定
explanations_and_examples.example: Circumstances dictated that they played a defensive rather than attacking game.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【v.】say words for sb. else to write down 口授；让（某人）听写
explanations_and_examples.example: She's dictating a letter to her secretary right now.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] a force that causes bad things to happen 罪恶；邪恶
explanations_and_examples.example: There's always a conflict between good and evil in his plays.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [C] (esp. AmE) a share in a company 股份；股票
2) [C, U] a supply of a particular type of thing that a shop has available to sell 存货；现货
explanations_and_examples.example: We have a huge stock of quality carpets on sale.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, usu, sing.] the business of buying and selling shares in companies and the place where this happens 证券交易（所）；股票交易（所）；股市
1) a situation in which people are suddenly made very anxious, and make quick decisions without thinking carefully 人心惶惶的局面；惶恐不安
explanations_and_examples.example: The magazine article is about the recent panic over the safety of baby milk.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) an overwhelming feeling of fear and anxiety 恐慌；惊恐
explanations_and_examples.example: The audience were thrown into a panic when the fire started.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the belief in the existence of a god or gods, and the activities that are connected with the worship of them 宗教；宗教信仰
explanations_and_examples.example: Try to avoid as much as possible subjects such as religion, sex, or politics.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) make sth. unable to operate normally 使无法正常运转
explanations_and_examples.example: The regional capital was paralyzed by a general strike.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) make sb. lose the ability to move part or all of their body, or to feel it 使瘫痪；使麻痹
explanations_and_examples.example: Her legs were partly paralyzed in the crash.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: very famous and admired 非常有名的；大名鼎鼎的；传奇式的
explanations_and_examples.example: He is legendary for his fearlessness and determination.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a scientist trained in psychology 心理学家
explanations_and_examples.example: Psychologist Martin Lloyd-Elliott is also a best-selling author.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【vt.】influence sb. so that they begin to behave in an unacceptable or shocking way 使（行为等）不合情理
explanations_and_examples.example: I never had any toys since my father thought that they would warp my personal values.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【v.】become, or make sth. become, twisted or bent out of its natural shape, for example because it has become too hot, too damp, etc.（使）扭曲，弯曲，变形
explanations_and_examples.example: The window frame must have been warped; it won't close properly.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (~ to / with) be the same as or match sth. 相一致；符合
explanations_and_examples.example: Your account of the event does not correspond with hers.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the state of continuing to live or exist 生存；幸存
explanations_and_examples.example: The man's survival was surprising, as the doctors thought he would die.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a member of a group of people that lives by hunting and looking for plants that can be eaten, rather than by keeping animals for food or by growing crops 采猎者（以打猎和采集植物为生的人）
suddenly run somewhere very quickly, esp. in order to escape or because you are frightened 逃跑；跑开
explanations_and_examples.example: The thief bolted when he saw the policeman.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: rub your fingernails against your skin 抓；搔
explanations_and_examples.example: Jessica lifted her sunglasses and scratched her nose.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: run very fast for a short distance（短距离）快速奔跑，冲刺
explanations_and_examples.example: I saw Charlie sprinting through the traffic toward me.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a part of a cell in a living thing which controls its physical characteristics, growth, and development 基因
explanations_and_examples.example: He said he was good at sports because he had the athletic gene.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sb. who is related to a person who lived a long time ago, or to a family, group of people, etc. that existed in the past 后代；后裔
explanations_and_examples.example: They are descendants of the original English and Scottish settlers.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: firmly fixed and unchangeable（观念、原则等）根深蒂固的
explanations_and_examples.example: The report suggests that deeply rooted cultural and social factors play a role in these behaviors.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (of things or people) making a strong impression, because they are very large, good, skillful, etc. 给人印象深刻的
explanations_and_examples.example: The building looked as impressive in reality as it did in photographs.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: belonging to or connected with the National Socialist German Workers' Party which controlled Germany from 1933 to 1945 纳粹党的
[U] information which is false or which emphasizes just one part of a situation, used by a government or political group to make people agree with them（政府或政党为了影响民意而进行的）宣传
explanations_and_examples.example: These reports clearly contain elements of propaganda.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: thorough and complete 彻底的；完全的
explanations_and_examples.example: The Football League has announced its proposals for a radical reform of the way football is run in England.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【v. 】shout sth. in a deep powerful voice 咆哮；大声喊叫
explanations_and_examples.example: It was such a great performance that the audience roared with appreciation.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【vi.】make a deep, very loud noise 吼叫；呼啸
explanations_and_examples.example: We were so afraid as we heard a lion roar.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: namelessly; without giving a name 以匿名的方式；不透露姓名地
explanations_and_examples.example: The latest photographs were sent anonymously to the magazine's Paris headquarters.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (~ to) give your permission for sth., or agree to do sth. 同意；允许
explanations_and_examples.example: She asked her mother whether she would consent to a small celebration after her graduation.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the activity or business of drawing public attention to goods and services on television, in newspapers, etc. 广告活动；广告业
explanations_and_examples.example: The advertising campaign is aimed primarily at young people.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] sth. that causes problems and tends to stop sb. / sth. from succeeding or making progress 不利因素；缺点
explanations_and_examples.example: You have to balance the advantages of living downtown against the disadvantages.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (BrE sceptical) having doubts that a claim or statement is true or that sth. will happen 怀疑的；心存疑惑的
explanations_and_examples.example: They are skeptical about my chances of winning.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a person who writes novels 小说家
explanations_and_examples.example: Mark Twain has been regarded as the greatest American novelist of his generation.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (BrE transport) a system for moving people from place to place 交通运输系统
explanations_and_examples.example: The president wants to improve the nation's highway and mass transit system.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) the process of moving goods or people from one place to another （货物或人的）运输
explanations_and_examples.example: They promised that my baggage would not be damaged in transit.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: change sth. into a different form, or change sth. so that it can be used for a different purpose or in a different way 使转变；使转化；使改造
explanations_and_examples.example: This device can be used to convert a signal into a digital code.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] the first design of sth. from which other forms are copied or developed 原型；雏形；最初形态
explanations_and_examples.example: We plan to release a prototype this autumn for trial in hospitals.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (input, input; inputted, inputted) put information into a computer （向计算机）输入
explanations_and_examples.example: All call center staff do is input data into computers and so it makes every sense that you do it yourself to cut cost.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 智能手机
(only before noun) found or used now 目前的；现存的
explanations_and_examples.example: Under existing regulations, you are not allowed to bring animals into the country.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: relating to or done using the Web (the system of connected documents on the Internet) 基于网络的
explanations_and_examples.example: With the new web-based software, creating a purchase order should take just a few minutes.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a system of words, letters, numbers, or symbols that represent a message or record information secretly or in a shorter form 密码；暗码；电码；代码
explanations_and_examples.example: He received a message written in code yesterday and he didn't know what to do about it.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) connected with a large or capital city 大城市的；大都会的
explanations_and_examples.example: This is an issue that should be decided by local and metropolitan governments.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) of or being the very rapid use, handling, or showing of information by a computer 即时处理的；实时的
explanations_and_examples.example: We are designing a secure and real-time voice transmission system.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] used in the names of streets in a town or city 街；大街
explanations_and_examples.example: When we visited New York, we stayed in a hotel on Fifth Avenue.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: successful, and working in the way that was intended 有效的；产生预期效果的
explanations_and_examples.example: The cheaper drugs are just as effective in treating this disease.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: think or guess that sth. is smaller, cheaper, easier, etc. than it really is 低估；（对···）估计不足；看轻
explanations_and_examples.example: None of us should ever underestimate the degree of difficulty women face in career advancement.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a moment when you suddenly realize or understand sth. important 顿悟的时刻
explanations_and_examples.example: People are all familiar with the story of Issac Newton's epiphany about gravity (地球引力) and a falling apple.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) becoming old; rather old 变老的；陈旧的
explanations_and_examples.example: We need to replace some of the aging office equipment.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [C] a building or an area with a roof over it that protects you from the weather or from danger 躲避风雨的地方；避难处
explanations_and_examples.example: They built a rough shelter from old pieces of wood.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [U] a place to live, considered as one of the basic needs of life 栖身之地；住处
explanations_and_examples.example: They were in need of food and shelter after the earthquake.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (BrE) a small structure with a roof where you wait for a bus 公共汽车候车亭
powered by energy from sunlight 太阳能驱动的
explanations_and_examples.example: The company is developing a fully solar-powered car.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) relating to a town or city 城镇的；城市的
explanations_and_examples.example: The president's visit was the most important civic event of the year.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (fml.) make sth. less severe or extreme 使缓和；使温和；冲淡
explanations_and_examples.example: The heat in this coastal town is tempered by the cool sea breeze (微风).

explanations_and_examples.explanation: put a piece of equipment somewhere and connect it so that it is ready to be used 安装，设置（设备）
explanations_and_examples.example: It would cost about £3,000 to install a new heating system in a flat such as theirs.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, usu. sing.] the journey to work every day 上下班路程
explanations_and_examples.example: I want to rent an apartment near my office because my daily commute takes too long.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] the head of the government of a town or city, etc., elected by the public （民选的）市长，镇长
explanations_and_examples.example: The crowd gathered in the town square to hear the mayor speak.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (not before noun) feeling doubt about sth. 不确定的；没把握的；拿不准的
explanations_and_examples.example: It's still uncertain whether the College Spring Sports will be held this year.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: positive and making you feel that good things will happen 乐观的；积极向上的
explanations_and_examples.example: New research shows that all it may take to avoid this common disease is a positive and upbeat attitude.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: on the way 在路上；在途中
explanations_and_examples.example: We stopped for a picnic en route.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 吊车；起重机
[C] (fml.) sth. sb. does, esp. sth. that is very good or very bad（尤指很好或很坏的）行为，行动
explanations_and_examples.example: His heroic deeds were celebrated in every corner of the city.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: cause sth. to start or develop, esp. suddenly 引发；触发
explanations_and_examples.example: Will the rapid rise in oil prices spark another crisis?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: take part in an activity with other people 加入，参加（活动）
explanations_and_examples.example: Now and again he'd join in when we were playing video games.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used to introduce an explanation of sth. 换言之；换句话说；也就是说
explanations_and_examples.example: In other words, we have to build different ways of working.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used to talk about a series of similar things or events that are done or happening with very little time between them 一个接一个
explanations_and_examples.example: One after another, people described how hard it was for them to get medical care.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: stay in the original place 留在原地
explanations_and_examples.example: Nigel says for the moment he is very happy to stay put in London.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: consider sth. carefully so that you can make a decision about it 权衡；仔细考虑
explanations_and_examples.example: You have to weigh up in your mind whether to pursue your goal or not.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: at a time in the future 过后；后来
explanations_and_examples.example: I hate to rush you but I have another appointment later on.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: become even more unpleasant, difficult, etc. 每况愈下；越来越糟
explanations_and_examples.example: For the past couple of years my health has gone from bad to worse.

children.word: make a, no, some, etc. difference

explanations_and_examples.explanation: have an effect / no effect on sb. / sth. 有（或没有、有些等）作用，关系，影响
explanations_and_examples.example: The new central heating has made an enormous difference to the house.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: operating normally 正常运转
explanations_and_examples.example: We're trying to get the medical facilities up and running again.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: telephone a radio or television program with a comment or question 打电话到（电台、电视台）
explanations_and_examples.example: It's a hot topic, and people have been calling in all morning.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make sure that sth. is actually true, correct, or acceptable 核实；查证；调查
explanations_and_examples.example: Maybe we ought to go down to the library and check it out.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: pull or knock down a building, wall, etc. 拆毁，拆除（建筑物、墙等）
explanations_and_examples.example: The city government has decided to tear down several buildings and create a park.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (also 'sb. can't help but do sth.') used to say that sb. is unable to change their behavior, or feelings, or to prevent themselves from doing sth. 某人忍不住做某事；某人不能停止做某事
explanations_and_examples.example: In fact, I can't help wondering what someone with your experience is doing in a place like this.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: decide that sb. / sth. is useless, unimportant, or a failure 认定某人/某事无用（不重要，失败）
explanations_and_examples.example: It's too soon to write off the project as a failure.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: drive to the side of the road and stop your car, bike, etc. or make sb. else do this （使）车辆停靠在路边
explanations_and_examples.example: The police signaled to him to pull over and gave him a drunk driving test.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 所罗门 • 阿希（美国社会心理学家）
（非洲）塞伦盖蒂（联合国教科文组织‘人与生物圈计划’的生物圈保护区）
约瑟夫 • 戈培尔（纳粹德国宣传部长）
W. 萨默塞特 • 毛姆（英国著名小说家）
约翰 · 基夫（人名）
曼哈顿（美国纽约市一个行政区，纽约市的商业和文化中心）
美国加利福尼亚州的一家科技公司
门洛帕克（美国加利福尼亚州城市）
【n.】[U] the feeling of wanting sth. that sb. else has 羡慕；忌妒
explanations_and_examples.example: They only say such unkind things about you out of envy.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【vt.】wish that you had sb. else's possessions, abilities, etc. 羡慕；忌妒
explanations_and_examples.example: I envy her ability to talk confidently to people she has never met before.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: give sb. great satisfaction and enjoyment 使愉快；使高兴
explanations_and_examples.example: Her recipe will delight anyone who loves chocolate.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: very pleased and happy 愉快的；高兴的
explanations_and_examples.example: Thanks for your invitation. I'd be delighted to come.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (usu. passive) (BrE) put sb. on a short list for a job or a prize 把（某人）列入入围（决选）名单
explanations_and_examples.example: He was shortlisted for the Nobel Prize for Literature several times.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) if your heart or stomach lurches, it seems to move suddenly because you feel shocked, frightened, etc. （因震惊、惊恐等而）感到心猛地一跳，胃里猛地翻腾了一下
explanations_and_examples.example: Virginia's heart lurched painfully in her chest on hearing the news.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) walk or move suddenly in an uncontrolled or unsteady way 突然不稳地行走（移动）；蹒跚而行
explanations_and_examples.example: Suddenly the horse lurched to one side and the child fell off.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) if your head or the room is spinning you feel as if you might faint because you are shocked, excited, or drunk （因震惊、兴奋或醉酒）头晕，感到天旋地转
explanations_and_examples.example: I was pouring with sweat, and my head was spinning.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) (cause to) turn round and round fast （使）快速旋转
explanations_and_examples.example: He spun the wheel sharply and made a U turn in the middle of the road.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if you clench a part of your body such as your hand or your mouth, or if it clenches, you close it tightly, esp. because you are angry or upset （尤指因生气或不安）握紧，绷紧，咬紧
explanations_and_examples.example: Through clenched teeth she told him to leave.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【v.】become stiff or make a part of your body become stiff （使）（身体的某一部分）变得僵硬，变得僵直
explanations_and_examples.example: Sofia's throat had tightened and she couldn't speak.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【vt.】close or fasten sth. firmly by turning it 使变紧；拧紧
explanations_and_examples.example: I'd put the new tyre on and tightened up the wheel.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: move information on a computer screen up or down so that you can read it （将计算机屏幕上的信息）上下滚动，滚屏（以便阅读）
explanations_and_examples.example: Scroll to the end of the document and you will find what you need.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: slightly 略微；稍微
explanations_and_examples.example: He was vaguely aware of footsteps behind him.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [U] chance or luck, and the effect that it has on your life 运气；机遇
explanations_and_examples.example: I had the good fortune to work with a brilliant head of department.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [C] a very large amount of money 大笔的钱；巨款
explanations_and_examples.example: He made his fortune in car sales.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) make sb. have a strong feeling or reaction 激发，激起（强烈的感情）；引起（强烈的反应）
explanations_and_examples.example: Looking at the photographs stirred childhood memories of the long hot summers.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) move a liquid or substance around with a spoon or stick in order to mix it together 搅；搅拌；搅动
explanations_and_examples.example: Stir the paint to make sure it is smooth.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (not before noun) specially protected from sth. unpleasant 豁免的；可免于···的
explanations_and_examples.example: The criminal was told that he would be immune from prosecution (起诉) if he helped the police.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) safe from a disease, because you cannot be infected by it （对···）免疫的，有免疫力的
explanations_and_examples.example: This blood test will show whether or not you're immune to the disease.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: worrying or upsetting 令人不安的；使人烦恼的
explanations_and_examples.example: There was something about him that she found very disturbing.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: relating to the way that your mind works and the way that this affects your behavior 心理的；精神的
explanations_and_examples.example: Robyn's loss of memory is a psychological problem, rather than a physical one.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) relating to treating or testing people who are sick 临床的
explanations_and_examples.example: The therapy has helped people with clinical depression.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: worried and embarrassed about what you look like or what other people think of you （因顾虑自己的外表或他人的看法）忸怩的，害羞的，不自然的
explanations_and_examples.example: Bess was self-conscious about being shorter than her two friends.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [pl.] websites and software programs used for social networking 社交媒体
explanations_and_examples.example: Social media is changing the way people communicate, work, and shop.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a good idea about what you should do, write, say, etc., esp. one which you get suddenly 灵感
explanations_and_examples.example: Dreams are a rich source of inspiration for some writers.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the application of cosmetics 化妆
explanations_and_examples.example: I got my wedding makeup done in this beauty studio.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: causing damage to people or things 毁灭性的；造成破坏的
explanations_and_examples.example: Lack of trust is very destructive in a relationship.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: wanting sth. that sb. else has 羡慕的；忌妒的
explanations_and_examples.example: I'm so envious of you getting an extra day's holiday.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sb. who is trained to treat people with a mental illness by talking to them instead of giving them drugs 精神治疗医师
feel angry or upset about a situation or about sth. that sb. has done, esp. because you think that it is not fair （因受委屈而）对···感到愤恨
explanations_and_examples.example: I resented having to work such long hours.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: feeling angry and upset about sth. that you think is unfair （对不公平的事）愤恨的，不满的，憎恶的
explanations_and_examples.example: They were bitterly resentful of the fact that they had to work such long hours.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] a feeling of being comfortable, healthy, and happy 舒适；健康；幸福
explanations_and_examples.example: The warm sunny weather always gives me a sense of well-being.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【n.】[C] a strong wish or need 强烈的欲望；迫切的要求；冲动
explanations_and_examples.example: He could no longer resist the urge to go and see Amanda.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【vt.】strongly suggest that sb. do sth. 竭力主张；强烈要求；敦促
explanations_and_examples.example: They urged Parliament to approve plans for their reform program.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: able to be easily harmed or hurt 脆弱的；易受伤的
explanations_and_examples.example: Their constant arguments left her feeling increasingly vulnerable and insecure.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the feeling of being satisfied with your own abilities, and that you deserve to be liked or respected 自尊（心）
explanations_and_examples.example: e.g. Educated people are found to have higher self-esteem.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] the lack of sth. that you need in order to be healthy, comfortable, or happy 缺少；匮乏
explanations_and_examples.example: Sleep deprivation can result in mental disorders.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] willingness to allow people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them 忍受；容忍；宽容
explanations_and_examples.example: He shows little tolerance for people with different views.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] unwillingness to accept ways of thinking and behaving that are different from your own 偏狭；偏执；不容异己
explanations_and_examples.example: The party was accused of stirring up a climate of fear and intolerance.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: deserving respect, attention, or admiration 值得尊敬的；值得注意的；值得敬仰的
explanations_and_examples.example: The money we raise will be going to a very worthy cause.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: recognize or express the difference between things or people 辨别；区别
explanations_and_examples.example: It's important to differentiate between fact and opinion.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) not normal or natural and likely to be harmful 反常的；病态的
explanations_and_examples.example: Frank has developed what I would term an unhealthy relationship with these people.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) likely to make you ill 对健康有害的；会致病的
explanations_and_examples.example: He worked in the unhealthy environment of a coal mine.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) the feeling that you need to eat 饥饿感
explanations_and_examples.example: I can't believe that that enormous meal wasn't enough to satisfy your hunger.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) lack of food, esp. for a long period of time, that can cause illness or death （尤指长期的）饥饿，饥荒
explanations_and_examples.example: Is it possible to end poverty and hunger in a decade?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (~ with) happen at the same time as sth. else, esp. by chance 同时发生（尤指巧合）
explanations_and_examples.example: I timed my holiday to coincide with the children's school holiday.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] the state of not feeling at all confident about yourself, your abilities, or your relationships with people 不安全；没有自信；没有把握
explanations_and_examples.example: She had developed an outgoing personality to mask her deep insecurities.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: working independently for different companies rather than being employed by one particular company 从事自由职业的
explanations_and_examples.example: He has been a freelance journalist for the BBC for a decade.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] 神经外科（学）
explanations_and_examples.example: Now I am chief of pediatric neurosurgery at John Hopkins Children's Center in Baltimore.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: very surprising, upsetting, and difficult to believe 惊人的；骇人的；令人难以置信的
explanations_and_examples.example: It is shocking that they involved children in the crime.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: encourage or help an activity to begin or develop further 激励；促使；促进
explanations_and_examples.example: The government should do more to stimulate investment in the rural areas of the state.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: officially tell sb. what to do 命令；指示
explanations_and_examples.example: He instructed his men to collect information about troop movements.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: two things that are unrelated are not connected to each other in any way 无关的；不相关的
explanations_and_examples.example: The police think that the two incidents are unrelated.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: having or showing good health and strength 强健的；健壮的
explanations_and_examples.example: He looks robust and healthy.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) if a feeling, attitude, or action is contagious, other people are quickly affected by it and begin to have it or do it （感觉、态度、行动）富于感染力的，会蔓延的
explanations_and_examples.example: Daffy has a contagious enthusiasm for life and poetry.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) a disease that is contagious can be passed from person to person by touch （疾病）接触传染的
explanations_and_examples.example: Mumps (腮腺炎) can be a contagious disease.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] when people laugh, or the sound of people laughing 笑；笑声
explanations_and_examples.example: He delivered the line perfectly, and everybody roared with laughter.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (fml.) cause sth., esp. a mental or physical change 引起，促使，导致（尤指精神或身体的变化）
explanations_and_examples.example: Taking a brisk walk can often induce a feeling of well-being.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) (fml.) persuade sb. to do sth., esp. sth. that does not seem wise 劝诱，诱导（尤指做似乎不明智的事）
explanations_and_examples.example: Nothing would induce me to take that job.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the length of time that sth. continues 持续时间
explanations_and_examples.example: For the duration of the strike our shop will remain closed.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the quality of being felt very strongly or having a strong effect 强烈；剧烈
explanations_and_examples.example: The storm started again with even greater intensity.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) a feeling or an impression caused by a particular experience 感觉；感受
explanations_and_examples.example: I can remember the first time I went sailing — it was a wonderful sensation.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) a feeling that you get from one of your five senses, esp. the sense of touch （感官的）感觉；（尤指）触觉
explanations_and_examples.example: Massage (按摩) produces wonderful sensations.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: needing electricity to work, produced by electricity, or used for carrying electricity 用电的；电动的；带电的
explanations_and_examples.example: The electric guitar, along with rock-and-roll, rose to popularity around the world.

explanations_and_examples.explanation:
vt. 
(~ sb. / sth. with sth.) make a connection in your mind between one person or thing and another 联想；联系
explanations_and_examples.example: Most people associate this brand with good quality.

explanations_and_examples.explanation:
n.
[C] sb. with whom you work or do business with 同事；（生意）伙伴
explanations_and_examples.example: They have been business associates for decades.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [C, U] sth. that is not directly said or shown, but that is suggested or understood 含意；暗指；暗示
explanations_and_examples.example: I resent the implication that my work is not thorough.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [C, usu. pl.] a possible future effect or result of an action, event, decision, etc. （行动、事件、决定等的）可能的影响（后果）
explanations_and_examples.example: The new report has far-reaching implications for the future of broadcasting.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: surprise sb. very much 使大为吃惊；使惊愕
explanations_and_examples.example: What astonished me most was her lack of common sense.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: so surprising that it is difficult to believe 令人惊讶的
explanations_and_examples.example: It's astonishing how much the place has changed.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (also 'neurone') 神经元；神经细胞
[C] 神经传递素
connected with electricity; using or producing electricity 电的；用电的；发电的
explanations_and_examples.example: Since the Great Depression, every new electrical appliance has come with a promise that it would transform the home.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] 神经生理学
(only before noun) relating to music or consisting of music 音乐的；配乐的
explanations_and_examples.example: She has no formal musical qualifications.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) suitable and likely to make sth. happen or succeed 有利的
explanations_and_examples.example: The disease spreads quickly under favorable conditions.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) a favorable report, opinion, or reaction shows that you think sb. / sth. is good or that you agree with them 赞许的；称赞的；肯定的
explanations_and_examples.example: We have had a favorable response to the plan so far.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: give support to an opinion, idea, feeling, etc. and make it stronger and more likely to continue 加强，强化（观点、思想、感觉等）
explanations_and_examples.example: The latest figures reinforce the view that economic growth is slowing down.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] a strong feeling of uncontrollable anger 盛怒；狂怒
explanations_and_examples.example: He would sometimes fly into a rage for no reason at all.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] an imaginary or ancient creature that is large, ugly, and frightening 妖怪；怪兽；怪物
explanations_and_examples.example: A terrifying monster attacked the helpless villagers.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 电缆
1) (infml.) near and easy to reach 手边的；附近的
explanations_and_examples.example: Keep your pills handy just in case you feel seasick.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) useful 有用的
explanations_and_examples.example: It's very handy having a light above your desk.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (~ to / with) if two or more facts, ideas, etc. correlate or if you correlate them, they are closely connected to each other or one causes the other （使）相互关联
explanations_and_examples.example: Stress levels correlate strongly with heart disease.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] the length of time that a person or animal lives or is expected to live （人或动物的）寿命，预期生命期限
explanations_and_examples.example: Worms have a lifespan of a few months.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used when you are mentioning a fact that you wish was not true 不幸地；令人遗憾地
explanations_and_examples.example: Unfortunately, you were out when we called.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) showing no emotion, understanding, or interest 无表情的；木然的
explanations_and_examples.example: Zoe looked at me with a blank expression.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) without any writing, print, or recorded sound 无字迹的；空白的
explanations_and_examples.example: Sign your name in the blank space at the bottom of the form.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: into or inside a building 往室内；在室内
explanations_and_examples.example: Mother was advised to stay indoors for a week after her cough seemed better.

explanations_and_examples.explanation:
a.
kept in prison or in a place that you are not allowed to leave 被关押的；遭监禁的
explanations_and_examples.example: She was kidnapped and held captive for over a week.

explanations_and_examples.explanation:
n.
[C] sb. who is kept as a prisoner 俘虏
explanations_and_examples.example: They freed their captives before surrendering.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a situation that could possibly happen 可能发生的事；可能出现的情况
explanations_and_examples.example: Imagine a scenario where only 20 percent of people have a job.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] when a person or animal is kept in a prison, cage, etc. and not allowed to go where they want 拘禁；囚禁；关押
explanations_and_examples.example: Animals bred in captivity would probably not survive if they were released into the wild.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] (also 'automatic pilot') a machine that flies a plane by itself without the need for a pilot （飞机上的）自动驾驶仪
(spoken) used after a list of things to mean that there are many more you could mention 凡是你说得出的（应有尽有）
explanations_and_examples.example: Vodka, whisky, beer — you name it, I've got it.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: not have the chance to do sth. that you enjoy or that would be good for you 错失机会
explanations_and_examples.example: Well, I'm glad you could make it; I didn't want you to miss out.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: concerning 关于；涉及

explanations_and_examples.explanation: be good enough to do a particular job or to reach a particular standard 合格；达到某个标准

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (infml.) when the subject being discussed is a particular thing 谈到（做）某事时
explanations_and_examples.example: He's a bit of an expert when it comes to computers.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (also 'every so often') sometimes, but not often or regularly 偶尔；有时

explanations_and_examples.explanation: try very hard to improve or achieve sth. 努力提高；努力实现

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if information, facts, etc. sink in, you gradually understand them or realize their full meaning （信息、事实等逐渐）被充分理解
explanations_and_examples.example: He paused a moment for his words to sink in.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used to say that what you are saying about one thing is also true about sth. else 对···同样如此
explanations_and_examples.example: Ben never touched beer, or any kind of alcohol for that matter.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: as a way of being safe from sth. that might happen or might be true 以防万一
explanations_and_examples.example: Take an umbrella, in case it rains.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: based on a calculation about how many times sth. usually happens, how much money sb. usually gets, how often people usually do sth., etc. 平均来看
explanations_and_examples.example: My income's rather variable, but I earn £73 a day on average.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (spoken) doing sth. secret or sth. that you should not be doing 正在做（秘密或不该做的事）
explanations_and_examples.example: The children are very quiet. I wonder what they're up to.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: the opposite of what you have just mentioned 正相反；倒过来
explanations_and_examples.example: Now the reality was just the other way round.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 脸书（美国社交网站）
亚里士多德（古希腊哲学家、科学家）
雷切尔 · 安德鲁（人名）
帕特里夏 · 波莱德里（人名）
伊扎克 · 弗里德（人名）
加州大学洛杉矶分校
弗兰肯斯坦（小说人物名）
definitely true or certain 不可否认的；无可争辩的
explanations_and_examples.example: The link between poverty and bad health is undeniable.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: ordinary and not interesting or exciting 平凡的；平淡的；乏味的
explanations_and_examples.example: The mundane task of setting the table can be fun on holidays.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] 咸猪肉；熏猪肉
(written) so interested in sth. that you do not notice anything else 全神贯注的；专心致志的
explanations_and_examples.example: She listened to the speaker with rapt attention.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: feel or express great surprise or admiration at sth., esp. sb.'s behavior （尤指对他人的行为）感到惊讶；钦佩；赞美
explanations_and_examples.example: I marvel at my mother's ability to remain calm in crisis.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 应用程序；应用软件
1) put sb. in a situation where they are not protected from sth. dangerous or unpleasant 使暴露（于险境）；使置身（于危险）当中
explanations_and_examples.example: The report revealed that workers had been exposed to high levels of radiation.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) show sth. that is usu. covered or hidden 显露；露出（通常掩盖或隐藏的东西）
explanations_and_examples.example: He lifted his T-shirt to expose a scar across his chest.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) not protected from attack 无保护的；易受攻击的
explanations_and_examples.example: These developments leave the company in an exposed position.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) not protected from the weather 无遮蔽的；不挡风雨的
explanations_and_examples.example: This side of the garden is exposed to wind.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [C] any of the long threads that carry messages between the brain and parts of the body, enabling you to move, feel pain, etc. 神经
explanations_and_examples.example: She was diagnosed with a rare condition which affected the nerves in her back.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) (~s) [pl.] feelings of worry or anxiety 神经紧张；焦虑不安
explanations_and_examples.example: Sean drank a large glass of brandy to calm his nerves.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) the state of being human rather than an animal or machine 人性

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) people in general 人；人类（总称）
explanations_and_examples.example: We want a clean environment for all humanity.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (~ with / between / among) the activity of talking to other people, working together with them, etc. 交流
explanations_and_examples.example: The researchers watch through a two-way mirror the interaction between mother and child in a small room.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) a process by which two or more things affect each other 相互影响；相互作用
explanations_and_examples.example: Price is determined through the interaction of demand and supply.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) lacking any human qualities in a way that seems strange or frightening （怪异、恐怖而）异于人类的
explanations_and_examples.example: I quit this inhuman job. I don't want to work for a machine.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) very cruel or without any normal feelings of pity 残暴的；无同情心的
explanations_and_examples.example: The prisoners had suffered inhuman treatment.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make sb. feel that they cannot think clearly or do not understand 使困惑；把（某人）弄糊涂
explanations_and_examples.example: I understand the text but the diagrams are confusing me.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: unclear and difficult to understand 令人困惑的；模糊不清的；难懂的
explanations_and_examples.example: The road signs were very confusing and we ended up getting lost.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: in a way that appears to have a particular quality when this may or may not be true 看上去；表面上；外观上
explanations_and_examples.example: The new minister was faced with a seemingly impossible task.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: conflicting ideas, beliefs, opinions, etc. cannot exist together or both be true （想法、信仰、观点等）冲突的，矛盾的
explanations_and_examples.example: It can be difficult to balance the conflicting demands for our time.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) express annoyance or disappointment about sth. that you think is unsatisfactory or unfair 抱怨

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) express feelings of great sadness about sth. （为···）悲痛，痛惜

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (fml.) seeming to be everywhere — sometimes used humorously 似乎无处不在的（有时为幽默手法）

explanations_and_examples.explanation: very modern 先进的

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (~ sb's imagination / attention, etc.) make sb. feel very interested in sth. 引起某人想象；吸引某人注意等

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) catch a person and keep them as a prisoner 俘虏；逮捕
explanations_and_examples.example: Government troops have succeeded in capturing the rebel leader.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] a group of people or things that are all of the same type 类别；种类；范畴

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (BrE categorise) put people or things into groups according to the type of person or thing they are 对···进行分类；把···归类

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) give sb. the information and skills that they need to do sth. 使有能力；使能够胜任

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) provide a person or place with the things that are needed for a particular kind of activity or work 装备；配备
explanations_and_examples.example: They spent a lot of money equipping the school with new computers.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [C] sth. that you notice when watching sb. / sth. 观察结果

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) [C, U] the process of watching sb. / sth. carefully for a period of time 观察；注意；监视
explanations_and_examples.example: Most information was collected by direct observation of the animals' behavior.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【n.】(~s) [pl.] the way in which things or people behave, react, and affect each other 动态；（事物或人）相互作用的方式
explanations_and_examples.example: He did research on group dynamics and leadership styles.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 【a.】1) continuously moving or changing 不断移动的；不断变化的；动态的
explanations_and_examples.example: These countries are characterized by highly dynamic economies.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) full of energy and new ideas, and determined to succeed 精力充沛的；有创新思想的；志在成功的
explanations_and_examples.example: We're looking for someone positive and dynamic.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: a remark or event that is revealing shows you sth. interesting or surprising about a situation or sb.'s character 揭露真相的；揭示内情的
explanations_and_examples.example: The document provided a revealing insight into the way government works.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) happening sometimes but not often or regularly 偶尔的；不经常的
explanations_and_examples.example: He spent five years in Paris, with occasional visits to Italy.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) if two things intertwine, or if they are intertwined, they are twisted together （使）缠绕；（使）交织在一起
explanations_and_examples.example: He told us a story in which the present and the past intertwined.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) if two situations, ideas, etc. are intertwined, they are closely related to each other （使）（局势、观点等）紧密相关
explanations_and_examples.example: Her fate intertwined with his.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: without a pause or interruption 持续地；不间断地
explanations_and_examples.example: He has lived and worked in France almost continuously since 1990.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C]（照相机的）镜头
frame or express (words, or a concept or plan) differently 全新地拟定（或表达）（话语、概念或计划）
explanations_and_examples.example: She is trying to re-frame the debate about the care of children in need.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] (BrE mobile phone)  移动电话；手机
deliberately not obeying people in authority or rules of behavior 叛逆的；反叛的；反抗的
explanations_and_examples.example: Her teachers consider her a rebellious, trouble-making girl.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: not considered to be modern or fashionable anymore 旧式的；老式的；过时的
explanations_and_examples.example: His idea is regarded as rather old-fashioned.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] 翻盖手机
(infml.) completely stupid or crazy, often in a way that is dangerous 愚蠢的；疯狂的
explanations_and_examples.example: For some insane reason he decided to do the whole journey in one day.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (only before noun) used to talk about the total amount of sth. that is received, paid, measured, or calculated in a month 按月结算的；每月的
explanations_and_examples.example: Summers are hot here, with monthly average temperature above 30 °C.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] if there is a possibility that sth. is true or that sth. will happen, it might be true or it might happen 可能；可能性
explanations_and_examples.example: There is always a possibility that he might go back to Seattle.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] the act of making a computer, machine, or piece of software better and able to do more things （计算器、机器、软件的）升级
explanations_and_examples.example: The upgrade to the latest version costs $395.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the process that a mobile phone uses when it is in a different country or area from usual, and has to connect to a different network （手机）漫游
send out electronic signals, messages, etc. using radio, television, or other similar equipment 传输，发送，传送（电子信号、信息等）
explanations_and_examples.example: The system transmits information over digital phone lines.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, usu. pl.] a gas or other substance that is sent into the air 排放物；散发物
explanations_and_examples.example: The government has decided to clean up industrial emissions.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) [C] a place where waste is buried under the ground 废弃物填埋场
2) [U] the practice of burying waste under the ground, or the waste buried in this way 废弃物的填埋；填埋的废弃物
containing poison, or caused by poisonous substances 有毒的；由有毒物质引起的
explanations_and_examples.example: Toxic chemicals have been spilled into the river for the past three months.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: an action, event, etc. that is decisive has a big effect on the way that sth. develops 决定性的；关键性的
explanations_and_examples.example: It is the chief executive's opinion that is ultimately decisive.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: at a time that is not fixed 任何时候
explanations_and_examples.example: They should arrive anytime between noon and 3 p.m.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: free sb. from feelings or conditions that make their life unhappy or difficult 使自由；使摆脱束缚
explanations_and_examples.example: Writing poetry liberated her from the routine of everyday life.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: having such a great effect on you that you feel confused and do not know how to react 难以抗拒的；令人不知所措的
explanations_and_examples.example: She felt an overwhelming desire to tell someone about what had happened.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sth. difficult or worrying that you are responsible for 重担；负担
explanations_and_examples.example: His family responsibilities have started to become a burden.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C, U] (~ to do sth.) a strong desire to have or do sth. even though you know you should not 引诱；诱惑
explanations_and_examples.example: Resist the temptation to buy the item until you're certain you need it.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] when sb. / sth. is present in a particular place 出席；到场；存在
explanations_and_examples.example: Your presence is requested at the club meeting on Friday.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sb. who sees a crime, accident or other event and can describe what happened （罪案、事故、事件的）目击者
explanations_and_examples.example: According to witnesses, the thief escaped through the bedroom window.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: interrupt sb. or become involved in their private affairs, in an annoying and unwanted way 打扰；干涉
explanations_and_examples.example: Would I be intruding if I came with you?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: affecting sb's private life or interrupting them in an unwanted and annoying way 干涉的；打扰的
explanations_and_examples.example: Some residents of the island found the presence of the film crew too intrusive.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the ability to continue waiting or doing sth. for a long time without becoming angry or anxious （持续等待或长时间做某事的）耐心
explanations_and_examples.example: Teaching children with special needs requires patience and understanding.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the ability to understand other people's feelings and problems 同情；同感；共鸣
explanations_and_examples.example: The nurse should try to develop empathy between herself and the patient.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U, sing.] a feeling of liking or love and caring 喜爱；钟爱；慈爱
explanations_and_examples.example: She looked back on those days with affection.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] quiet serious thinking about sth. 沉思；冥想；默想
explanations_and_examples.example: The monks spend an hour on contemplation each morning.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (~ for / to) extremely important and necessary 极其重要的；必不可少的
explanations_and_examples.example: It is becoming almost essential for students to learn a second language.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if you fulfil a hope, wish, or aim, you achieve the thing that you hoped for, wished for, etc. 实现（希望、愿望、目标等）
explanations_and_examples.example: Visiting Disneyland has fulfilled my boyhood dream.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: making you feel happy and satisfied because you are doing interesting, useful, or important things 令人满意的
explanations_and_examples.example: Each of these courses is academically challenging and personally fulfilling.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: able to exist or be used together without causing problems 可共存的；可兼用的
explanations_and_examples.example: Are measures to protect the environment compatible with economic growth?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the feeling of being grateful 感激（之情）
explanations_and_examples.example: I would like to express my gratitude to everyone for their hard work.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: relating to Greece, its people, or its language 希腊的；希腊人的；希腊语的
expect that sth. will happen and be ready for it 预期；预料
explanations_and_examples.example: We need someone who can anticipate and respond to changes in the fashion industry.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) serious, important, or useful 严肃的；重要的；有用的
explanations_and_examples.example: They want a chance to do meaningful work.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) having a meaning that is easy to understand and makes sense 有意义的；浅显易懂的
explanations_and_examples.example: These statistics are not meaningful to anyone but a scientist.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: so interested or involved in sth. that you do not notice anything else 极感兴趣的；全神贯注的；专注的
explanations_and_examples.example: Judith was totally absorbed in her book.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [U] the ability to control your mind and body in order to achieve sth. that you want to do 毅力；意志力
explanations_and_examples.example: It took all his willpower to remain calm.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: [C] sb. who owns sth. 所有人；物主；业主
explanations_and_examples.example: The police have been unable to trace the owner of the vehicle.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) make it certain that sth. will happen 使必然发生；确保
explanations_and_examples.example: The process of training does not automatically guarantee you a job.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) promise to do sth. or promise that sth. will happen 保证
explanations_and_examples.example: I guarantee you will love this film.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: tie sb. / sth. so that they cannot move or are held together firmly 捆绑；系
explanations_and_examples.example: They bound the package with brightly colored ribbons.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: close or join together the two parts of sth; become closed or joined together （使两部分）系牢，扎牢，结牢，扣紧
explanations_and_examples.example: I was so fat that my skirt wouldn't fasten.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) (not before noun) an experience, situation, etc. that is unreal seems so strange that you think you must be imagining it 不真实的；虚幻的
explanations_and_examples.example: It seemed unreal to be talking to someone so famous.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) not related to real things that happen 脱离现实的；不切实际的
explanations_and_examples.example: Many people have unreal expectations of what marriage will be like.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 1) if you disconnect or become disconnected from your feelings, family, society, etc., you no longer feel you belong or have a relationship with them （使）脱离（关系）；（使）不联系
explanations_and_examples.example: Divorced men can too easily become disconnected from their children.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 2) remove the supply of power, gas, water, etc. from a machine or piece of equipment 切断（机器或设备）的电力（煤气、水）等供应
explanations_and_examples.example: You should pay attention to disconnecting the machine from the mains first.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: make sb. feel certain that sth. is true 使确信；使信服
explanations_and_examples.example: Her arguments didn't convince everyone, but changes were made.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: (not before noun) feeling certain that sth. is true 确信的；信服的
explanations_and_examples.example: I was convinced that we were doing the right thing.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: completely different in attitudes, opinions, etc. （观点、态度等）有天壤之别
explanations_and_examples.example: On the surface, they look the same. But in reality, they are worlds apart.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: give or leave sth. to people who will live after you 传给（后代）
explanations_and_examples.example: The ring was handed down to her from her grandmother.

children.word: hang on sb.'s every word / words

explanations_and_examples.explanation: pay close attention to everything sb. is saying 倾听（注意）某人每一个字 / 说的话
explanations_and_examples.example: She was watching him, hanging on his every word.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: want sth. very much, esp. when it seems unlikely to happen soon 渴望；盼望
explanations_and_examples.example: These were the words she had secretly longed to hear.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: mention sth. that makes sb. upset, angry, or embarrassed, esp. accidentally （尤指无心地）触到敏感话题，触到痛处
explanations_and_examples.example: You touched a raw nerve when you mentioned his first wife.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: show the most typical qualities of sb. / sth., esp. in a few words 简而言之；概括
explanations_and_examples.example: For me, the novel summed up the major problems of human existence.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: separate sth. into smaller parts so that it is easier to do or understand 拆分；把···分成若干部分（以方便做或理解）
explanations_and_examples.example: The question can be broken down into two parts.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used when you want to give the main point of sth. 总而言之；简单地说
explanations_and_examples.example: His novels belong to a great but vanished age. They are, in short, old-fashioned.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: become involved with and try to understand sb. / sth. 与···建立密切关系；尽力理解
explanations_and_examples.example: Are you so tired that you don't have the energy to engage with your kids?

explanations_and_examples.explanation: if sb. such as a doctor or engineer is on call, they are ready to go and help whenever they are needed as part of their job （医生、工程师等）待命，随叫随到
explanations_and_examples.example: Don't worry, there is a doctor on call 24 hours a day.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: show that sth. is true or exists 见证（某事）；（为某事）证明
explanations_and_examples.example: The empty workshops bear witness to the industrial past.

children.word: on the contrary / quite the contrary

explanations_and_examples.explanation: used to add to a negative statement, to disagree with a negative statement by sb. else, or to answer no to a question 正相反；恰恰相反
explanations_and_examples.example: It wasn't a good thing; on the contrary it was a huge mistake.

explanations_and_examples.explanation: 《纽约客》（美国知识、文艺类综合杂志）
阿那克萨哥拉（古希腊哲学家）
皮尤调查（美国 Pew Research Center 开展的民意调查）
